text: Bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours brown with a touch of black raspberry. Very little visible carbonation and almost no head. Chocolate, hazelnut, slight suggestions of honey and leather. The taste blows me away: sweet and laden with lightly spiced honeyed notes. Theres a gorgeous balancing hoppy bitterness, but the foreground is all about the slightly spicy sumptuousness. Cinnamon, liquorice, rosemary and a touch of horehound lead up to the long finish. Gooey mouthfeel and it feels a lot more carbonated than it looks, giving the body strength. A prince of an ale.

Bottle.
Dark brown color, creamy head. Aroma: port wine, chocolate, caramel, berries. Taste: sweet, oatmeal, bitter finish, warming alcohol. Good!
Something almost like a Scottish Belgian ... Nice musty aroma, a lot of caramel and malts in the flavor, alco totally hidden, kind of viscous and maybe (unfortunately) a bit syrupy

bottle @ home. Pours brown with a tan head. Aroma of deep, warming fudge, caramel, licorice, herbs, chocolate and some dark fruits. Medium o big body and a very good duration. Smooth palate. Flavors of chocolate, caramel, fudge, gentle spices, vanilla, chocolate, licorice. Very nice.

Bought this on a whim, as it is hard to find imports where I live and my store got this in. Absolutely fantastic. Coriander balanced by chocolate, thick malt, hint of hops and many more nuances every time I take a sip. Must try for anyone who has not had it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nose caramel with some sweetness and maltiness. Amber with small head and malts as well. Taste is sweet, rich and malty. Some caramel on the palate as well.

330ml bottled 2016-10-26, best before 2026-10-26. Pour dark brown with mahogany reflexions. Dense off-white foam is like a fireworks in my glass and then vanish. Aroma is liquorice, caramel and malty. Taste, sweet brown sugar, toasted and warm alcohol. Full body and medium carbonation for the style. Oily and slick, long sweet and toasted finish.
Bottle. Color brown with almost no head. Aroma sweet malt, malt, bread, some alcohol. Taste sweet, caramel, alcohol, roasted, bread.

Clear, dark mahogany colored with a very thin head and no lacing on the glass. 
 
Nose: Caramel malt, fudge, brown sugar, molasses, dark fruit, coffee and vanilla. 
Taste: A lot of malt in the taste. Caramel, dried fruit, raisin, plum, oak and brown sugar. 
Mouth: Medium body and carbonation. Crisp.

Aroma: malty with fruity esters, dried-fruit, dark caramel, a bit alcohol.
Appearance: brown color without head.
Taste: medium malt character, dark caramel, dried fruits, alcohol, dry finish.
Palate: medium body, moderate carbonation.
Pours dark brown, almost black. Aroma is sweet chocolate, toasted malt and caramel. Taste is chocolate, roast and vanilla.

Bottle, Total Wine. Light bodied but clinging sweetness and harsh spices keep it interesting. Good clean flavors. Toasted bread, caramel, chocolate, coffee and a slight hue of hops. Over-ripe plums, port and smoke balance it out. I can pick up the coriander but its mellowed by clove and licorice.  Solid dark ale. Loving these Traditinal Ales.

Birra dal color marrone scuro. Schiuma beige, cremosa e persistente. Allolfatto sentori di frutta secca, caramello, malto tostato, lievemente speziata. Al palato corpo pieno, venature dolci ed alcoliche, caramello, toffe e liquirizia. Unottima birra da sorseggiare, causa la sua alcolicità e il suo corpo.
Bottle from systembolaget. Dark brown /copper with faint beige head that leaves lacing. Nutty aroma and taste with lightly burnt caramel, malts and some dark fruit. Solid.

Bottle. Very dark brown in colour with reddish tint. Malty spicy aroma. Very malty (roasted malts, caramel, demerara sugar, chocolate). Spicy (coriander, nutmeg & cinnamon). Fruity (dark fruit, raisins, plums, dates, berries). Sweet very malty very spicy fruity ale. Wow. Complex. Terrific Traditional Ale! (2008)
Pours dark brown with a tan head that recedes quickly. Aroma has a lot of caramel, plums, roast. Taste has roast, strong caramel, plums, berries, sugar/candy sugar.

A smell of my childhood. Something delicious candy I ate when I was little. The flavor is coffee, chocolate and good malty. OK bitterness which fills the upper part of the mouth a weak moment. Really good beer. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Hel klar, brun, khaki färgat skum. Doft: Kola, malt, lite likör, mild av torkad frukt. Tydlig men ej oangenäm alkohol doft. Smak: Kola, Cola, malt, lite alkohol, frukt soda, lätt jäst frukt.

Tenemos delante una cerveza muy oscura. Al trasluz se aprecia marrón, pero ya os digo que la sensación es de estar delante de una cerveza negra. Carbonatación baja y capa de espuma muy pequeña de color marrón claro.

Lo primero que se aprecia en su aroma es malta tostada y café. De nuevo la sensación no solo visual de estar delante de una Stout. Pero el abanico se va abriendo y aparece también fruta madura y especias.

Tiene mucho cuerpo. En boca sabe jugar con los amargos del café tostado y los dulces de la fruta madura. Tiene además toques picantes y especiados. De hecho en su etiqueta especifica que contiene especias, pero no indica nada más. Como veis, un birrote muy complejo y con cierto carácter a buen licor, lo que la hace ideal para tomar sin prisas en una buena sobremesa con un postre de chocolate

UPDATED: APR 17, 2017 Partagée avec mon cher Appiantiqua dans nos petits verres Duvel 18cl.
Belle robe cuivrée aux reflets rubis surmontée dune mousse beige peu persistante avec une bonne carbonatation.Le nez nous offre des arômes extraordinaires,très complexes avec des notes vineuses,florales,fruitées...La bouche nous amène sur des saveurs aussi variées à limage du nez avec la chaleur de lalcool dominant mais dans un bon équilibre.Un barley wine excellent!17/20

UPDATED: APR 16, 2017 Dégustée avec mon Kittenbieer dans un verre Duvel 18cl.
Température de début 8 à 9°.
Très belle robe sombre à reflets cuivrés surmontée dune mousse beige peu persistante; bonne carbonatation.
Nez  agréable avec des arômes boisés et de discrètes notes houblonnées et maltées.
Le goût est amène des saveurs de vieux whisky et de subtiles notes de torréfaction le tout dans un bon équilibre.
La finale de bonne longueur reste au même niveau dexcellence avec le retour des houblons et la persistance des alcools vieillis en fûts.
17/20

Bottle from systembolaget Sweden. Tiny brown head. Very dark amber color. A very nice and complex aroma from chocolates caramell and spicy finish. Sweet caramell taste with a low chocolate and bitterness taste. Solid body and a very nice sipping beer.

33ml bottle, callared since 2007. Interesting nose of poached pears with cinnamon under the cap. In the glass, it follows with a malty barley wine smell, with just a little bit of phenol from aging. Color is deep brown to black with just a tiny ring of foam at the edge.
Taste starts of with a very thin, non-carbonated mouthfeel. Well, thats the UK style, I guess. An old recipe meant to be experienced, perhaps, from cask. It does get pretty warming after I put my goblet down. But it could also be due to age. Can hold that against the brewer, since this did have a "Best Before June 2011" on the label. So I try to adjust. Spice is not as prominent as it might be. Sediment at the bottom, but it stays in the bottle, no yeast to decent like a Belgian beer.
Still, an interesting experience with a histroical beer, and Im happy to have had it.
A complex, thoroughly balanced caramel-malt forward beer with a lovely low carbonation and a beautiful colour, great accompaniment for pondering on the year that was 2016.
Shared 500 ml bottle. Best before June 2018. Dark brown with a short-lived off-white head. Aroma and taste of malt, dark fruit, caramel, earth. Didnt think it lived up to its reputation...

Deep mahogany color, beige head. Caramel malty nose, bread yeast, brown sugar, spicy, hint of anise. Caramel taste, rich malty, spicy notes, dates, nuts, smooth and balanced. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily texture.

I expected much more from this bottle than what I poured. It is a thin, medium caramel colored pour with a very slight head that all but totally dissipates immediately leaving a thin white line as a halo on the edges. The aroma and taste just didnt bring to me what I expected. The 8 ABV doesnt come through in the flavor but I feel it so I know its there.

Aroma: extremely malty; Appearance: clear, dark amber with thin white head that disappears quickly; Taste: follows nose with tons of malt; usually not my favorite style but its not overly sweet; Palate: heavy body with long, malty finish; Overall: decent but wont seek out again.

330ml bottle. Very dark mahogony brown with a slight redish hue and almost no head. Aroma is dried red and black fruits, warming alcohol, toffee, plums and red stonefruits. Taste is dried fruits, nutty malts, toffee, dry-ish bread, red stonefruit, light roastiness, herbal notes and light coffee. Surprisingly light mouthfeel, medium carbonation and dry, fruity and herbal, aftertaste.
UPDATED: DEC 10, 2016 Smakrik och hyfsat söt med den lite fadda tonen. På hela taget en trevlig sippöl så här i juletider.

330ml bottle from Systembolaget. Deep dark mahogany, small tanned head, weak lacing. Rich aroma, sweet, malty, vinous, molasses, dried sweet fruit, red grapes and mild spicy. Medium carbonated which goes well with the rich malty body, sweet and smooth mouthfeel. Complex taste, malty, caramel, toffee, dark dried fruit, dates, red berries, woody and a tiny spiciness, coriander and juniper. Warming finish with bitter orange.
Love both Traquair House and Traquair Jacobite equally. Cant pick between the two.
Ruby red, clear, low head. Dried fruit aroma. Sherry like and raisin taste. Small bubbles lingering.

Bottle shared thanks to bjammin, cheers Ben. Black beer with small head. Aroma of licorice, treacle and dark malts. Taste is treacle, dark malt, some hops and earthy with some brandy notes. Light to medium bodied. Very good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text:
Dried fruits, alcohol, light soy sauce, spicy, vanilla, earthy, Grass. 
Dark Brown colour, red hues, small beige head. 
Big sweetness, salty, light bitterness, coffee and jam, warming.
Medium/fullbodied, soft carbonation, warming finish.
Brown. With no head. Aroma is plums and alcohol. Taste is plums, sugar, dark fruit, and slight alcohol. Thin, but strong and good sipping beer.
Bottle from SB. Dark reddish amber with a tiny tan head. Malty and fruity tones. Malt, caramel, fruit and hebs. Medium to full body with a long malty / spicy finish.
33 cl bottle from systembolaget. Pours amber with little head. Sweet spicey aroma with toffee and caramel taste. Some spicey after taste with hints of uniper and caramel.

Sweet sugar, peppermint candy cane, and sweet fruit aroma. Taste of cola, spices, and ripe berries.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Mycket vackert mörkt rubinröd med beiget skum. Stor lite vinös doft med sötma av olika torkade frukter - dadlar, fikon mm - även lite mörkt bröd. Söt fruktig smak av torkade frukter med en liten fin kryddighet och en aning alkoholhetta. En riktigt god strong ale.

Red/brown color with small off white head. Aroma of dates and prunes, overripe grapes, wood and alcohol. Taste is medium sweet (notes of raisins and prunes), light bitter and has a bitter and sour finish. Really nice depth in this beer. A bit too acidic in the finish Im afraid I think though.
Rich sweetness and spice. Like sugar coated licorice; choc, cardamom and coriander nose. Sleek but longish choc and caramel finish.

0.33 l bottle from Firma Bier, bottled in July 2014. Clear, extremely dark red with a thin, frothy, slowly diminishing, off-white head. Sweetish, malty, spicy, moderately fruity and a bit vinous aroma of toffee, raisins, prunes, some oak and spices. Sweetish-malty, moderately fruity and quite spicy taste of toffee, raisins, prunes, vanilla, orange peel, coriander and some oak, followed by a medium long, moderately bitter, spicy and slightly vinous finish. Medium body, smooth and slightly effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Very tasty, quite complex and not too spicy. Delicious!

Bottle
Aroma-caramel, chocolate, alcohol, 
Appearance-ruby, clear, tan foam, 
Taste-medium sweetness, lightly sour, lightly bitter, 
Palate-medium body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good

Pours dark brown with a moderate off white head. Aromas of butterscotch, caramel, fudge, figs, dates, raisins, plums, pumpernickel bread. Taste is loads of caramel sweetness and ripe fruit, mainly apple. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Very good!

Aroma brings out good english hops and malty character. Strong malty line continues in taste. The hops are lost somewhere, but thats ok. A whole new buquet of flavors is present. Dark fruits, barrel notes and brandy-like finish. Alcohol only tickles a bit. What a great beer, very enjoyable.
33 cl bottle from SB. Dark brown with beige head. Dried fruit, bread spices, chocolate, malt. Medium+ sweetness, light roastiness, light creamy mouthfeel. Good!

Brunsvart, maltig och fyllig smak. Torkad frukt och söt fin smak. En god öl att möta hösten med

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Flaska från SB. Brun med ljusbrunt skum. Söt och kryddig doft, kanel, nejlika och pepparkakor. Lågt kolsyrad. Smaken påminner om doften plus lite choklad.
Mahogny color, medium beige head. Sweet aromas of figs, sugar, caramel and raisins. Sweet, balanced taste of caramel, dried fruits, brown sugar and slight grass. Fruity and sweet. I like it.
Flaska från SB. Ekbrun färg med smutsgrå skumkrona. Doft av pumpa och rostad karramemalt. Söt kropp. Smak av karramemalt, pumpernickel och knäck.
UPDATED: NOV 3, 2016 Nearly perfect ale. Brown-red with a thin lacy head. Spicy/sweet aroma on a malty backbone. Really smooth and perfectly balanced taste. Really, really good. Highly recommended.
500 ml bottle from Liquor Barn. Dark opaque brown, raisin aroma. Dark fruit malt taste, interesting bittersweet finish.

Appearance: brown, dark red, clear, minimal head. Aroma: bread, roasty, alcohol, kvass. Taste: medium sourness, lightly bitter, medium sweetness. Palate: medium body, thin feel, average carbonation, medium bitter, short aftertaste. Astringent.

Bottle at home after celebrating a unexpected rochdale win over Bolton. Brown with medium silky beige head perfect in the glass. Taste figs port brandy marzipan outstanding sipper would work well with a cigar.
Sample at a Systembolaget tasting. Smell of caramel, roasted sugar and dried fruit. Similar taste but not as sweet as expected. Nice!

Aroma of fig, raisins and corriander. The body was black with brownish tinges. Mouthfeel was smooth yet it had a little bite despite the lack of carbonation. Flavor of plum. licorice, fig and spices, the alcohol was well hidden. Overall i wouldnt want to drink too many of these in a row its a little to sweet for me, and its overpriced, but it is a good brew thats worth a try. Originally rated on 10/23/08

500ml bottle. 12/28/23 BB date. Appearance: Dark brown with deep ruby/garnet hue, clear, and a moderate khaki colored head that lingers nicely. 
Aroma: Rich caramel, bready maltiness with a strong citrus and coriander character. Also a little vanilla and oak. 
Taste: Rich malt sweetness, mostly caramel with a touch of toast, a spicy coriander, and ends with a light oak and just enough bitterness to balance the sweetness. Almost had a dark candi sugar flavor. 
Mouthfeel: Medium to heavy body. Has a nice creaminess, with a moderate carbonation and just a touch of alcohol warmth. 
Finish: Dry and tannic with a lingering caramel maltiness and touch of spicy coriander. 
Overall: Awesome twist on a classic Scotch Ale. The coriander gives a spicy citrusy note that provides a nice contrast to the rich maltiness. Oak character is really restrained, only noticeable in the aroma.

Pours dark brown with medium beige head. Aroma is roast, raisin, plums, caramel, cinnamon, biscuit, some grass, hay, dust. Taste is fruity, plums, caramel, toasted bread, oily, biscuit, some jam, dried apples, white chocolate. Very nice beer!

Bruna e poco schiumosa, non effervescente. Nocciole, ciliegie, caramello, prugne, malto, fichi. Corpo medio, vellutata, finale amarognolo. Ci vorrebbe un pizzico in più di intensità, attacca un po al palato. Equilibrata.

0.33 l bottle from Uba ja Humal, Tallinn. Appearance is brown/ruby. Aroma has caramel and liquorice. Taste has that too, and salt, spices and lots of malts. Very good and dangerously strong. Reminds me more of Belgian dark ales than any of the English or Irish stouts and porters.

330 ml bottle 
Clear dark mahogany body with a good head. 
Loads of raisin, date and other dark dried fruity flavors. Hints of faint spices. Smooth body with near perfect, light carbonation. 
Excellent!
How : bottle Appearance : unclear dark brown , no head. Aroma : caramel, dried fruits, orange peel, chocolate, mild coffee notes. Palate : medium body, soft carbonation.

June 2016 - Bottle share in Watford as Traquair Jacobite Ale, 8%, 2009 vintage. Many thanks to Paul for this classic. Opaque black with a red hue, foamy tan head. Aroma is rye bread, spicy, molasses, chocolatey. Body is smooth with soft carbonation. Taste is dark chocolate, light metallics, molasses, burnt wood, some spice. Just a touch papery and oxidised sherry notes. But has held up pretty well for a 7 year old beer and is tasting good. Pretty impressive, I think. Really wasnt expecting it to be this good. (3.9)

One of the absolute best Scotch Ales out there. Dark brown pour, larger beige head. Aroma of cherry, spice, dried dark fruit, cocoa, caramel, oak. Malt forward taste, dried dark fruit, spice, dark bread, oak, leather, dark chocolate, earth, nuts,. Medium body.

330 ml bottle. Pours a dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is dark fruits, some candied cherries, bready, baked spices, yeasts. Taste is dark fruits, some cherry and wine notes, caramel, slight hoppy bitterness. Roasted malt and hoppy bitterness, dry aftertaste. Very good beer. Do not overcool it before tasting.

Bottle shared at the Watford tasting, many thanks to Paul for this one. A but brown coloured pour with a fading tan head. Aroma is cola cubes, strawberry, nutty brown malts. Flavour is composed of airy old malts, jammy fruit, nutty earthy malts, cola cubes, earthy roast. Palate is semi sweet, moderate carbonation, semi sweet. A little age.
A nice beer overall. Pours a beautiful deep red with a tan head. Smells of nuts and smokiness. Tasty is smoky, with some vanilla and nuts. Had in the bottle.

Second go on this one; my first being at the brewery in Innerleithen way back in 2006. This one a 2012 vintage and by vague memory - no notes for my last visit - this seems to be smashingly consistent but not without its own nuances. Into a Traquair tulip at cellar temperature. Deepest ruby with good clarity and a shimmering radiance when held to the lights. Head holds at just a half finger of tight, shiny beige-ish cream. Doughy, thick, molten chocolate pudding nose with inklings of anise, mace, green peppercorn, leather, sweet berries like strawberries, light vanillin and a good whiff of tawny port. It is dessert-like on the palate, well melded and on a sweeter-tip. Quite dusty in the back; earthy with an aniseed/juniper-like spice that lasts long between each sip. It is dominated by decadent vanilla chocolate icecream. A little age has given it strong madeira and light sherry notes. The body light but its soft suppleness and amped flavours give it plenty of moorish appeal. Alcohol melds into it - noting the madeira. Earthy, musty and leathery undertones add extraordinary depth. This is just a delight to savour and sip. A true credit to the last Jacobite stonghold. Near perfection. Loved it!!! 33cL, BBE 07/20, Cellarbrations. Carlisle)

Clear deep amber brown body, small brownish head. Aroma of toffee, dried fruits, candy sugar, alcohol fusel. Flavourq of caramel, complex malt notes, candy sugar, alcohol. Caramel medium finish, slight bitterness. Fairly dry. Good sipper.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark brown colour. Beige modest head. Hints of caramel, vanilla, banana, dark fruits, plums, spicy notes in the aroma. Vanilla and caramel at first. Spices, bready notes, hints of chocolate in the middle. Spicy, quite sweet finish. Hints of alcohol and spices in the aftertaste. Rather medium bodied, medium carbonated, rather sweet beer. Average balance. Quite sweet palate. Quite drinkable.

BOTTLE 33 CL. Clear dark ruby, beige head. Big malty and fruity aroma, molasses, dried and fresh plums, fortified wine. Taste: rich smooth malts with oxidative notes of pelicular wines - dried prunes and a nutty light bitter finish. Would benefit from a little more body and some alcoholic heat too, but otherwise excellent.

Bottle from BeerLovers, Vienna. Pours dark brown colour with a tan head. Aroma of sweet malt, caramel and alcohol. Taste of sweet malt, caramel, alcohol and berry fruits. Soft carbonation and medium bodied. Enjoyed it.
Bottle.Dark brown with a small head. Malty with spices in background. My first from this brewery which I have tended to overlook for all the new craft breweries which was a mistake.

Clear deep brown amber color with small brown foam. Aromas on the sweet side of honey, heather, malt, caramel and straw. Palate, full body, thick sticky texture, with light carbonation leaving nice warm, spice and malt finish. Taste is on the sweet side, tastes aged, malty and on the strong side. Has some hints of heather and herbs. Overall, my first traditional ale from this region but very nice and enjoyable! Do strongly recomend it!
Bottle. Dark brown nearly black body with tan head. Aroma is cocoa with slightly roasted malts. Taste is dark caramel with nuts and hints of herbs. Aftertaste is nice balanced.
Mørk brun med høyt lys brunt skum. Lukter vått trevirke, mot mugg, mørk sjokolade og espresso. Søtlig kandis, vanilje. Fyldig noe alkohol og brent karamell og sjokoladebitterhet.

Bottle.

A- Caramel, grapes, sweet tarts,

A- Dark brown color, dark liquid, off white head.

T- Grapes, sweet tarts,

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, vinous finish.

O- Starts of smelling quite complex but quickly turns to smelling and tasting like grape sweet tarts or grape medicine. Overall, a tasty beer but not as complex as it probably should be. I think the House Ale edges this one out. Coriander is there too.

0.33l bottle. Deep ruby body, thin off-white head. The aroma is quite heavy. It has some caramel, figs, chocolate, sherry and toast to it. Taste of caramel, dates, cherries and chocolate. Sweeter, heavier and a bit more sour than the House Ale. I prefer the other one over this, but its still nice.

Bouteille. Nez malté de caramel toffee bien sucré aux notes fumées et terreuses, de réglisse noire, fruité (confitures de prunes sucrées, notes de raisins), épicé (coriandre) et herbeux avec des notes dalcool doux liquoreux et de chocolat. Rondeur moyenne en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture crémeuse et légèrement liquoreuse. Goût fruité très légèrement sûr (prunes et léger de raisins aux notes vineuses avec des notes de pommes vertes et de mûres), assez épicé (coriandre, notes de gomme de pin et de poivre) lors de lentrée en bouche suivi dun goût malté de caramel toffee sucré (rôti et notes fumées, notes de bonbon sucré) parallèlement à un goût dalcool moyen-doux liquoreux, léger de réglisse noire et de chocolat noir qui aboutit à une finale assez herbeuse, un peu sèche de noix et légèrement amère de houblon herbeux (petites notes résineuses) et avec de faibles notes de café. Arrière-goût moyen-long et un peu sec, légèrement amer de houblon herbeux et dalcool doux (avec des notes de rôti et de chocolat), avec des notes sèches de noix et une légère aigreur fruitée (moût de prunes, de raisins et pelures de pommes) et épicé. [notes 2005]

Bottle from supermarket.
Deep brilliant brown with red hues.
Strong, pungent aroma of caramel, cherries, fortified wine. After a while gets smoother and "elegant"
Flavour follows the aroma with caramel, malt, candy syrup and cherry brandy.
Georgous mouthfeel! Big beer, dense on the palate, very little carbonated, with warming alchool and sweet aftertaste. Almost no hop detected, very little bitterness

Bottle from Connollys Wines, Solihull. Poured a clear medium brown with a thin broken off white head. The aroma is sweet malt, creamy caramel toffee. The flavour is moderate sweet with a rich red berry fruit, light alcohol bitter palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Pours dark brown without much head, taste is medium dark and smooth with oak, oak/whisky finish

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Quite strange ale with a lot of caramel and sweet aromas and tastes. Its too sweet. Herbs, herbs, sweet herbs. Not balanced for me.

Bottle from Willows Market in Menlo Park, CA. Aroma is outstanding! Strong dark fruits, licorice, wild fennel, spiced dark forests filled with the wildest fruits. Taste is similar but with the oak mellowing things out nicely. Fantastical stuff here.

Pours dark brown to black with low light tan head. Aroma of basement, roast malts, nuts, muscovado, herbs. Taste is sweet, complex, herbs, sugar and yeast. Very Belgian in style. Body is medium to full, creamy and smooth, light boozy finish, soft carbonation.

Bottle bbe 12/22. Aroma and taste are pretty similar to a Doppelbock. Sweet, malty, dried fruit and a bit spicy. As it warms up some smokey taste emerges making it more complex. Nice beer for a cold winters evening but a bit too sweet for me.

Initial aroma smelled like dirty feet and licorice. However, it was too cold and as it warmed it became toasted wood and molasses. Beautiful root beer brown with a tan head. Lots going on in the flavor with licorice, coriander and ginger along with a milk chocolate note. There is a sense of root beer there too. More toasted wood in the finish with a lasting mint and herbal flavor along with more chocolate. Really interesting beer.

330ml bottle. Pours dark brown with a beige foam head leaving some lacing. Aroma of dark malt, zesty, spice. Taste is malt, bready, molasses, chocolate, raisins, with a floral note, and spicy, grassy bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry nutty light bitter finish. Very drinkable.

Flaska på Örebro Öl & Whisky Festival. Från festivalens i särklass trevligaste monter; Bishops Arms! Mörk rubinröd vätska med beiget skum. Fullt med friskt syrlig och fruktig kola och torkad frukt i mängd. Även choklad och möjligtvis ett något fruktigare kaffe i bakgrunden. Sötman dominerar. En del rökiga toner i smaken. Inte mycket kolsyra, lagom stor kropp. Ett litet humlebett och kaffe i eftersmaken. Kunde fått vara lite tyngre och något mer rostad, men väldigt trevlig. Någon för den sötsugne, tåls att sitta och smutta på en bra stund.

How: Bottle.
Where: SBWF 2015.
Appearance: Dark brown colour with a beige head.
Aroma: Spices, malt, dried fruit, raisin, a bit vinous.
Body: Full body, medium carbonation.
Flavour: Vinous, dried fruit, some berries, raisin.

330ml bottle, pours black, small, tan head. Rich malty aroma, dark treacly caramel, plums, dark, dried fruits, some lactics, texture is creamy and oily. Noble hop aromas in the finish which is sweet, carbonation is fine to flat.
Cest une bière foncée qui a bien du corps, ce qui va bien avec le fort taux dalcool. Malheureusement pas suffisamment carbonifié.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2015 330ml bottle at home shared with gf. BB 07/2024. almost black color, small coffee-colored head. smells malty sweet, raisins, spices, biscuits, some plums, some wood. nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of dried fruits, plums, raisins, very light roast notes, some (warming) alcohol, spices, a bit peppery. finishes a bit dry with some roast and notes of dried fruits, some alcohol and also peppery. decent stuff, was expecting a bit more, rather alcoholic, has a bit of a peppery / light dry / a bit bitter finishes that does not work for me so well. Overall good stuff.

Something thin foam, but a delicious aroma of fruit (berries?) And plenty of malt. The taste is incredibly full of hard toasted caramel malt, a little yeast and a good fruity aftertaste. It only slightly aroma hops and hop bitterness is gentle but in good balance with the malt-rich body, like most in this beautiful ale.

Nez très timide : on sent un fond caramel boisé.
En bouche : attaque agressive, pas mal dalcool et très pétillante.
Longueur plutôt caramel avec une très belle et excellente fin réglisse.
Un peu trop déséquilibrée pour me plaire vraiment.

De couleur brune avec de légers reflets rubis la mousse de couleur blanc cassé et à une ténacité correct
Au nez on va trouver des arômes de chocolat au lait de café doux et des notes légèrement boisé
En bouche des la première gorgée sentir des petites notes acidulée suivi de café et une légère amertume arrive par la suite c'est une bière qui est assez douce mais qui manque un peu de corps et de longueur
Pours dark brown.A decent beer. Strong malt flavor with a hint of corriander, roasted malt and a bit spicy.

33cl. [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ööbel. Pours dark brown with no head. Heavily malty. Gently bitter. Smooth when cold. Oily when warm. ABV is here. Ok, but nothing special.
330ml bottle at home, source unknown, spicy, treacle aroma, very dark brown near black, thin lively beige head, spicy caramel, viscous, hot finish
Clear amber, small head. Malty, caramel. Medium to low sweetness, astringent with a bitter bite. Low carbonation, medium body. Rough and not very pleasant.

Bottle. Courtesy of TVT. Cheers Tim. Clear, ruby red. Film and halo of beige head. Chocolate and raspberry. Not unlike a Raspberry Ruffle chocolate bar. Some stewed apple. Some cinammon and black pepper. Taste is soft, smoky sweet. Hint of fruity dryness. Soft carbonation. Smooth, albeit a bit watery. Finishes light, toffee sweet. Light, fruity dry close. Very drinkable.

Bomber into a pint glass. Pours a deep brown, almost black, with a medium khaki head that slowly fades into a disk on the surface. Nose is dark roast malt with a hint of toffee. Taste is moderately sweet dark roast malt, with coriander and spice on the finish. Moderate carbonation with a creamy mouth feel and long finish. Nice.

Bottle 0.33L.
Dark brown body with reddish nuances; average, frothy, tan head, mostly diminishing with some nice lacing, though.
Moderate malty (roasted, caramel) aroma with moderate-to-heavy notes of dark fruits (plums, blueberries), wine ans spices.
Moderate sweet flavour with light-to-moderate roasted bitterness; notes of licorice and light chocolate.
Medium-to-full body with creamy texture; soft carbonation.
Very nice and complex beer!

black color with a small tan head- Aroma is roasted, coffee, prune and raisin Flavor is dried fruits, alcohol, coffee Full body, light bitterness, medium roasted - a mix between a stout and a Belgian dark ale

Bottle, pours dark ruby with an off white head. Aroma: molasses, toffee, spices. Taste: dark fruit, molasses, toffee, biscuit, wood, nutmeg, vanilla. Sweet, light bitterness, oily to creamy texture, soft carbonation. Lasting spicy sweet finish.

Awesome brew.Pours a dark, opaque murky brown with a thin beige head, creamy and lignering. A nice aroma of toffee, molasses and cocoa with a heavy oak and barrel emphasis. Nicely done brew with mild bitterness, nice rich and complex malts and a sultry oak aged presence.

Dark cider/brown color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of toasted malt, dark fruit, molasses, & spice; Flavor of slight roasted sweet malt, caramel/syrup, rich fruit, some licorice, and spice; Fairly thin but tasty.
Nutty and caramel aroma, very sweet, a bit too sweet for my taste. Decent taste, fine brew. Just a bit too mundane on the palate for my liking.

Bottle @deTolly, Tartu. Pours brown with brownish head. Aroma is malty, sweet, caramel, slight honey. Taste is at first sweet,caramel, malty, coffee,some bitterness at finish, warmin alcohol in throat. Medium body. Good beer.
Surley sweet. Very complex, a lot of flavour. Strawberry, molasses, vanilla, plump. A very special beer, with watery texiture, good drinkability and a lot of flavours at the end
Pours a deep brown with not much head. Aroma is fruity and laden with summer berries. Taste is quite spicy, mince pie, raisins and some heat.

Tried both this beer and the Oak Aged version side by side. Both dark and malty sweet and thick. Oaked has more carbonation and less sweetness. Hard to nail the coriander. Raisin and toffee and rhubarb. Like them both but the Oak is was the favorite of the 4 of us tasting. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle - pours a deep reddish brown . Faint vanilla and dark fruit aroma . Taste brings a strong toasted oak flavor with vanilla and caramel malts . Smooth body . Very good . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from Favourite Beers Cheltenham. Deep cola colour with a thin tan head. The aroma is a touch like cola with fruit, the taste is very strong caramel.

Bottle. Small tan fizzy head with poor retention. Clear brown colour with honey hues. Aroma is chocolate, toasted caramel and prune. Flavour is coriander seeds, biscuit, molasses, toasted caramel and dried fruits. Medium oily palate, medium body and low carbonation. Roasted caramel aftertaste. 
Great, complex and amazing taste!

Bottle at home, 17th April 15. Pours deep dark brown, but clear. Little head. The aroma is burnt caramel, black treacle, liquorice. Taste is complex, caramel, molasses, cloves, slight alcohol. Body seems a little light. Good
UPDATED: SEP 16, 2015 Dark brown with almost no head. Aroma and flavours of caramel, oak, dried fruits, cherry, little cacao notes. Low carbonation, full body, sweet finish. Very good.

Bottle 33cl. Very dark but clear red brown color, small frothy beige head, recedes after a while to a thin layer, fair lacing; sweet malty nose, roasted, dark fruits, vanilla, cloves, licorice, chocolate, old madera; taste medium sweet and bitter, roasty, chocolate, spicy notes; full bodied, creamy texture, velvetty mouthfeel, soft carbonation, aftertaste rich and warm bittersweet, chocolate, spices, alcohol, quite dry palate at the end; overall a beer with a rich aroma, a round taste and a warm finish.

500 ml bottle bought at Gorgeous Wine & Cigar in Yuen Long.
Looks: Clear, deep burgundy black colour; Two finger head and crumpety light beige foam which lasted for 2 minutes; Fairly good sticky lacing and very slight carbonation.

Aroma: Very fragrant and rich Ale malt, with strong Sherry, chocolate, strong plums and dark fruits, caramel, toffee, cream, vanilla, sugar and yeast.

Taste: Mid to strong sweet rich dark malt, with strong coriander, strong Sherry, strong red wine, red fruits, caramel, molasses, alcohol, biscuits, strong yeast, liquorices, lemon, moderate bitter hop and light grass.

Body: Mid to light body. Thin but fairly slick palate.

Mouth Feel: Incredibly rich dark maltyness despite the seemingly light body. A blitz of aged Sherry, red wine, coriander and tasty alcohol hit me instantly and they taste just right. Just how often do I say that! Coriander taste is perhaps the strongest Ive had from a beer, not those wimpy flashes from Belgian Whites. These coriander is strong, veggy and for real. Yes! It mixes so well with those aged winey taste this is heavenly!

Hoppiness: Not much in aroma. Lemon, nice liquorice and light grass in taste. Bitterness is moderate at best as it share with Sherry and liquorices for a lasting mid to light sweet-bitter finish.

After Taste: Slightly dry. Refreshing and sweet to mouth.

Comments: While its House Ale is full on Wee Heavy, this one is insanely malty yet veg-refreshing at the same time. The coriander and aged winey taste works like magic, its intense but in a relaxing way. Great for sessions as well as chill out. Excellent!
A nice herbal spice to the aroma. Clear thick caramel color. The herb pull out in front and remain as the body builds around it. The spice adds a little zip to your tongue. Ends very rich and smooth.

Süsslich-fruchtig riechend, vielleicht dunkle Beeren, aber welche? Angenehm malzig-süss zu Beginn, kommt feine Bittere die gut entgegenhält. Beeren oder auch Feigen; Pflaumen nicht. Schöner Abgang, sehr feines Ale. Mehr davon.
Bottle 0,33ltr: Clear brown/ruby colored brew with an great sweet bitter taste with some dryness. Hints of caramel, liquorice and dried fruits.
1.2.2015. Dark ruby brown. Aroma is sweet caramel, wood, dried fruits, sherry. Taste has wood, sweet caramel, raisin, slight cacao.
Caramel, burnt sugar, earthy with dough like qualities a bit if letter and licorice with a tint of soy sauce, quite complex but thin and semi-dry.

Aroma: caramel, raisins
Appearance: deep brown, clear, tan head
Taste: medium sweetness, lightly bitter, 
Palate: medium body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish,
Bottle. Pours a dark black colour with a beige head, rich malt aroma, taste is light and malty a dry fruity finish.

UPDATED: MAR 20, 2015 AROMA : caramel, roasty, chocolate, herbs, banana.
APPEARANCE : red/ brown, clear, minimal head, white foam.
TASTE : medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour.
PALATE : light body, thin feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

Appearance: dark red clear liquid with minimal head. Aroma: caramel, toast, chocolate, herbs, banana, alcohol. Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, roasted malts, caramel. Palate: medium body, sticky, soft carbonation, long bitter finish,

Bottle. Pours clear very dark brown with a frothy small quickly diminishing head that leaves no lacing. Aroma of molasses, alcohol, whiskey and dark chocolate. Lightly bitter, light body, thin texture, average to lively carbo and a brief lightly bitter finish.

Pours clear brown with a thin light beige head diminishing to a thin skim, no lacing. (3/5) Nose is toffee malt, dark fruit, spices, liquorice, dark chocolate, woody oak. (8/10) Taste is moderately strong sweet, mild bitter. (7/10) Full bodied, low carbonation and slightly syrupy. (4/5)

Im not usually a fan of the Scottish styles, especially wee heavies, but this is a decent Traditional Ale. Its sweet, hovering on the edge of cloying, but theres a depth and complexity of flavour that saves it from being boring. Its not something Id choose for a go-to, but its definitely worth trying. (14/20)
Beautiful ale, lovely warmth from the spices and the alcohol. Tastes of dark fruits.
Bottle. Deep amber color with no head. Aroma of cream, butterscotch and vanilla. Sweet taste with some bitterness in finish. Medium body. A bit oily feel.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Poured into a Kwak glass. Appearance is ruby brown, fairly dark, a beige fizzy head which doesnt last long. Aroma- caramel, fruitcake, port, malty, brown bread, raisin. Taste- chocolate, fudge, caramel, almonds, cherry, sugary fruitcake, slightly fluffy mouthfeel, bitter at first but finishes sweet. Very nice indeed.

330 ml bottle, poured into a wine glass, black, no head. Aroma has some liquorice, dark plums, herbal liquor. Taste has some mild liquorice again, a weak hop bite, some caramel sweetness that gives way for a longer tingling aftertaste. Dry. Feels old. I guess this is nice example of the style, personally not crazy about it.

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2017 Bottle from The Bottle Lab, Leek. Pours a clear deep brown colour with a medium tan head. Aromas of caramel, roasted malts, plum, figs, toffee, pecans and alcohol. Taste of caramel, toffee, coffee, plum, liquorice and molasses, also a little oak and spiciness. Soft carbonation and medium bodied. A long and warming malty, spicy finish. A really lovely complex and drinkable beer, definitely buy this again.

Bottle 33cl / Botella 33cl.
@ Cerveceria Internacional.
A: Brown / Marron.
T/S: Malt, sweet, raisin / Malta, dulce, uvas pasas.
Bottled, serves half-pint perfectly. Short head, quite fizzy to start off. Cola on the nose, then toffee and caramel. Strong palate and sweet aftertaste.

In bottle. Beige, rocky, fairly persistent head. Dark Copper, bit cloudy. Fairly intense and persistent at nose. Dark honey, raisin, caramel, toffee, dark chocolate, something reminding scotch ale. Medium body, medium carbonation. Warming sensation. Sweet. Roast bitter.

Subdued chestnut and maple syrup nose. Clear brown, medium yellow head. Wood, pecan, and chocolate syrup. Light to medium body. A touch cloying, at least, far sweeter than its lack of complexity can support.

A clear dark body with a minimal head. Nose has sweet aromas of grapes and sherry. Taste is sweet with cola-like qualities and a mildly bitter finish. Low carbonation and rich palate. Quite nice, reminds a lot of swedish julmust.

Poured into a perfect pint. I assume this is the right listing, but this says "ale brewed with coriander and fermented in oak barrels" below the Jacobite Ale text.

3.0 A: Deep brown, nearly black, color. One and a half fingers of frothy beige head. Retention is below average and not much of any lacing is left.

4.25 S: Might not look great, but it smells great. Coriander hits you right on the first whiff and hits you hard. Earthy peatiness, light roastiness, caramel, molasses, brown sugar, mineral, and some spicy phenols. Very nice, but could use a bit more power.

4.0 T: Like the nose, the coriander is readily apparent. Underneath you find much of what the nose has: earthy peat, light roast, brown sugar, molasses, caramel. Mineral and phenols are upped somewhat in the taste. Though I love the taste of coriander, it does dominate the brew. Whether or not that is a bad thing, I dont know. But it does prevent a deeper inspection as to how the flavors mesh. Still, damn good.

3.5 M: Medium to heavier medium body. Good moderate carbonation. Somewhat slippery feel. Could use some more creaminess, but good enough.

4.0 D: I probably rated this higher than it deserves, but I love coriander so thats how it is. Worth a try either way though. Solid all around.


DavoleBomb, Jun 06, 2013

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2015 Very complex aroma, but dificult to define (banana, cola, chocolate...maybe), medium sweetness, medium bitter, dark brow ruby colour almost black, clear, tan foam, medium body, creamy-milkie feel, astringent, bitter finish that comes back...soft carbonation...good beer . And you can feel the coriander in the aroma and in the taste but very integrated.
Caramel and dried fruit notes in aroma. Dark red to brown colour. Very reach malty taste. Good strong ale in scottish manner.
Poured a dark see through brown. The head died off quick and left no lacing. Sweet and malty, then biscuity, toffee, light coffee malt, with some alcohol and subtle coriander. Average beer

It poured a brown color with a tan head. The aroma was of malts, caramel and slight notes of sweet cacao. The taste was of sweet malts with slight notes of vanilla and spiciness in the backend. Good stuff.
toast, nuts, black, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, full body, slick feel, average carbonation, long finish
Bottle. And here is a great Scottish ale. Caramel, dark fruit, nice and easy. Good beer

Pours a semi transparent dark reddish brown with a medium sized off white head that quickly becomes a thin spotty covering and good legs. Aroma is malty, molasses, nutty, spices, and dark dried fruits. Flavour is malty, molasses, some port like qualities, mild spice notes, a touch of chocolate and very light bitterness. Quite tasty and very enjoyable!
Very dark ruby-brown, no head. Smell is port, red wine, herbal. Taste is boozy punch, fragrant and bitter spices, some tannin, herbal aftertaste. Body is very light, almost watery.

UPDATED: DEC 20, 2014 Bottle. Pours deep clear amber with beige head with big bubbles. Aroma is tons of dark fruits, toasted malts, berries, nutty and subtle sweet port. Taste is sweet, bready dark malts, caramel and toasty. Body is bit sticky and sugary and medium to full. Toasty finish and only subtle spices. Slight booze.

Aroma is Belgian candy sugar, apple, plum, sweet malts and yeast. Taste is a nice sweet malt body with dark fruit notes. Moderate luquor snap but not bad at all. Appearance is a clear copper with a thin pearl head that retains fairly well

0,33 pullo@ OPP. Ei kovin sameaa, punertavan tummanruskea. Tuoksussa hyvin makeaa mallasta, karamellia, tummaa marjaa, luumua, siirappia, suklaata. Maussa pehmeää tummaa paahteista mallasta, palanutta karamellia, tummaa hedelmää.
Bottle at home. Pours dark brown, nose is fruity, toffee, taste is rich, sweet, fruity.

330ml bottle. Dark amber shade. What little head there is doesnt last long. Aroma is packed full of burnt bread, cola, peat, wood and liquorice. Taste follows similar lines, with added notes of sweet caramel malt and red berries. Its interesting and distinctive so I give it the thumbs up.

Saturated dark tea pours into a clear blood red-amber-brown body with a large eclectic structured bone white head fading quickly to a whispy cap and solid ring, minimal lacing

Aromas and flavors are as restrained as interesting and complex, balanced with nuances typical of dark belgian beers, dark fruit, cinnamon spice, apples and pears, some circus peanuts candy, an overlay of english caramels, red licorice, some faint wild accents woft away and seem to evolve into toasted oak no a med body which comes off a bit watery yet smooth, soft dryness with some dusty wood and nutty layers to finish, everything works harmoniously, and the label is killer

12oz bottle served at 45º into 13.25oz Stölzle Berlin glass
330ml bottle from Valhallas Goat. Aroma is chocolate for me while the flavour has chocolate and spice. Minimal head, low carbonation. Very pleasant ale.

Bottle from Colonial Spirits.
Brilliantly clear dark brown with wonderfully garnet highlights and a smallish off white head that took some coaxing to stir up and dissipated quite quickly. Aromas of stone fruit and brown sugary caramel and toffee with hints of smoke, light wood and non descript spice. The flavor follows through on what the aroma promised. Dark sugary maltiness with hints of caramelized sugars with lots of cherry and almond notes with touches of prunes and raisins. Light spice and alcohol flavor. Medium body with a moderate level of carbonation and a sweet lightly syrupy mouthfeel. Wonderfully complex sipping beer.
Sample at Strong Ale Festival 2014. Comes a dark reddish brown with a small tan head. Aroma of malt, fruit, and caramel. Taste is dark fruit, sweet malt, caramel, and spice. Very good.

Pours dark with good tan head. Slight fruity yeasty aroma. Quite high effervescence. Very light taste initially but soon develops to a lingering burnt apricot finish. Interesting beer, but doesnt beat the Traquair House Ale for me, which is still my favourite scotch.
Bue en bouteille. Belle surprise ! On sent le raisin, une pointe de caramel. Lalcool est présent mais bien dosé. Belle rondeur en bouche. Good one !
Dark brown pour some lingering tan fluff. Aroma berries, raisins, markers, smoke. tastes sweet smoke, leather, plums. Lactic sticky palate

Classic spiced Scotch ale since 1995, with a yellowish beige, medium thick but thinning and eventually breaking, moussy head, colour a very dark and clear ruby red, quiet fizz. Rich malty and spicy aroma which initially reminded me a lot of Rochefort 10, with impressions of banana, caramel candy, coriander, port wine, cloves, eucalyptus, raisins, pear, cognac, marzipan, chocolate, hazelnut paste, red wine, liquorice. Sweet onset, candied dates and cherries, rounded, rather thick and oily palate, smooth with a deep caramelly, nutty and eventually more chocolatey maltiness, adorned with strongish retronasal spiciness (especially coriander seed, subjective impressions of drop and cloves) with drying effect, further spreading into the satisfying, long and warm finish where some liqueurish alcohol, leafy hops and dark bittersweet malts are beautifully interwoven. Deservedly a classic, in which the maltiness combined with the coriander give it a somewhat Belgian bouquet.  I can imagine this tastes less common to a Scottish or English consumer than to a Belgian one.
"i LOVE their house ale...whyd they have to go and add coriander? i think it distracts from an otherwise solid beer. nice aroma and body, but the flavor is a miss. too bad..."

Birra scura incredibile. Se servita quasi a temperatura da il meglio di se e libera aromi fruttati e di cioccolata fondente incredibili. Nonostante lalta gradazione non si ha mai la sensazione di alcolicità sul palato. La maltazione è imponente ma il bilanciamento non ne risente grazie ai luppoli che regalano note speziate. Il finale è piacevolmente lunghissimo e dominato da aromi di liquerizia.

330ml bottle served in a pint glass. 
A: Simple but beautiful bottle art. Pours a very dark amber color forming a creamy and thin bubbled tan head. Medium retention and lots of spotty lacings left in the glass. A thin layer remains forever on the top
S: Very malty and metallic. Strong notes of toffee, caramel, caramel malts, roasted malts, oak, raisins. Roasted and a bit smoked
T: Sweet upfront. Very malty and a bit fruity. Again, strong notes of toffee, caramel, caramel malts, crystal malts, oak, roasted malts. Mild bitterness as a traditional ale should be
M: Heavy creamy body. Medium to low carbonation. Extremely malty aftertaste
O: Great drinkability. A classic that deserves its reputation
[ BA Review @ 11/6/2013 ]

33cl bottle served in a Trappist glass. Pours a very clear dark brown colour with a few large bubbles and a very short lived bubbly head. Aroma is quite subdued but there are notes of malt and sweetness. Taste is burnt sugar, toffee and caramel. Disappointing lack of spices. The taste is too one-dimensional and the mouthfeel quite watery. Disappointing.

Bottle from Au Grain DOrge - Dark brown near black color with a small tan head, good lasting and small lacing - Aroma is roasted, coffee, plum, dried prune and dried raisin, spicy - Flavor is dried fruits, kick of alcohol, coffee and spicy - Medium/full body, light/medium bitterness, good carbonation, medium roasted bitter finish - a mix between a stout and a Belgian dark ale, spicy with a powerful character

Dark red color, minimal beige head. Aroma of caramel, roasted malt, burnt sugar, dried fruits and herbs. Sweet taste has similar notes, light roasty bitterness in finish. Medium body and soft carbonation. Drinkable, but expected much more.

---- personal review, no claim to be representative or neutral ---- repost undesired ---

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice cloudy brown in the glass. Great dried fruit aroma; figs rasins and dates and a touch of smoke. Clean flavor of brown sugar, molasses and dried fruit. Overall a wonderfull brew... Thanks BarZigKin for sharing!

33 cl bottle from Liviko Alcostore in Tallinn harbour ( 3,10). BB Apr 2024. Pours a reddish brown, mahagony red against light. Head is tan, drops fast to leave a thin scattered layer, then disappears. Nose is sweet of dark autumn fruits like plums and dates, maybe even some apple notes there, but also caramel candy, crisp malts, spices. Taste is equally autumny, with molasses, plums and apples, and a considerable alcoholic zing after its warmed for a while (also on the nose). Its a bit like a weaker version of some Barley Wine. Finish balances nicely between spicy and bittersweet. Medium body with a nice and soft, velvety mouthfeel and mild, crisp carbonation. This is good. Im going to get a couple more bottles, and hope to restrain myself from opening at least one of these before 5-10 years. The idea gives me goosebumps.

Ruby brown, small creamy tan head. Nose is dried fruit, malt, fruity sweetness, coriander, malt. Flavor is chocolate, licorice, dried fruit, toasty notes and caramel, flowery notes in the delicately sweet-and-bitter finish. Reminds me of Westmalle Dubbel and I do like me some Westmalle Dubbel. Great balance, smooth palate.
Orange/marron opaque avec un petit tête beige. Larôme des pruneaux, sucre brun, malt, caramel et mélasse. Le goût à les mêmes carecteristiqies, sucré avec plein de corps.

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2014 0,33L bottle, BB 04.2022. Pours dark ruby-black with light tan head. The head stays for a moment. Aroma is sweet, fruits, caramel. Flavor is sweet, dark plums, raisins, chocolate, hint of spices, cognac like notes. Alcohol is well covered. Overall: great brew.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Black color and small head. Aroma has plums, oak, chocolate, roasted and caramel malt, dates, spices and some sourness. Taste is malty, a bit sweet and ends with long lasting liquorices, chocolate and caramel flavors. Also some oak and dates in flavors. Excellent.

Bue en bouteille de 50cl au Sherwood Pub (Nicorvo) couleur brune, effervescence et mousse peu présente. Une bière avec une attaque sur le fumé très prégnant limite brulée assez agréable, fin de bouche caramel.

330 ml bottle at GH. Brown with a ruby tint, off white head. Aroma sweet and bready, almost like svagdricka, some malt and burnt sugar. Taste is sweet, sugary, bread, light smoke, svagdricka and mild liquorice. A bit too sweet for me

33 cl. bottle, BBE December 2022... Clear, dark amber colour with a golden tint. Thin, off-white head, that lasts throughout. Fruity aroma with plums, resins, mild chocolate, caramel malts, toast, liquorice, rather spicy. Taste is sweet. Medium body with a creamy texture and a soft carbonation. Finishes rather dry and spicy with faint liquorice, dark fruits and light impressions of alcohol. Lovely, rather spicy.

Bottle; pours dark brown with a tan head; aroma of caramel, dark fruits, molasses, spices, and a hint of alcohol; flavor is sweet with roasted malt, dark fruit, caramel, a hint of spice and oak; semi-dry finish with a little alcohol warming; very little bitterness; drinks very smooth and the alcohol is barely noticeable; very good, complex beer

Bottle - pours dark brown with very thick tan head. Nose of malt, rum, and booze. Taste is of caramel, plums, rum, and malt. Would be nice to have sitting by the fireplace.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From bottle. Deep dark brown color with quickly dissipating tan head. Aroma is molasses, plum, and roasted chocolate malt, maybe some cherry also. Taste is similar to aroma, but a lit more subdued and with more molasses and some added roasted notes. Molasses finish, sweet but not too sweet.

Years of seeing this and I finally buy a bottle in SLC. Pours a dark brown with some ruby highlights and a thin tan head of tiny bubble that settles quickly. Bold aroma that reminds me of cinnamon cereal that has been toasted. Flavor has some molasses and spice. Good just make sure you let it warm a touch to get the full flavors.

Bottle @ weekly tasting shared by Dutchdrebus and Ansjelaah. Red brown color, small beige head. Smell and taste malts, slightly iron, slightly a hint of caramel, lightly bitter. Quite hard to describe imo. Decent body and carbonation.

bottle. Amber with one finger head. Caramel malt base with a bit of sweetness. Pleasant with a bit of booze, but I was hoping for something a bit more flavorful. I was a bit underwhelmed given the ratings.

This is one of the first truly interesting beers I had before the craft beer explosion. Fairly high in alcohol at 8%. Dark in color. Chocolate, caramel, and spices. It is brewed with coriander and it definitely comes through on the palate. Cool label, cool beer.
Bottle. This is a delicious ale with lots of depth of flavor and great malt character.
Bottle @benzai. Brown with a small head. Smells and tastes caramel, fruity, sweet, some alcohol, sterke drank.

Bottle @ benzai. Dark amber to copper colour with a small, creamy off-white head. Smells lokvoer (voor voorn), sweet, hint of vanilla. Tastes sweet, hint of iron/rust, malts, hint of liquoricewood. Thin body, soft carbo.

Sötétvörös színe mellé könnyen asszociálható, cseresznye, málna, füge édes aromája, diófélék és dohány, valamint egyéb, nehezen kibogozható fűszernövények egyvelege párosul. Klasszikus illat ez, egy efféle elegáns megjelenésű, nagy hagyományokról árulkodó küllemű főzethez egyebet el sem lehetne képzelni. Könnyed és élénk karakter fogad minket ezután, melyhez azonban fajsúlyos ízek kapcsolódnak. Aszalt gyümölcsök, kékszőlő zamatai képezik a befőttszerű, illetve gazdag malátás, édeskés alapízt - mely összetevők a végízben is szinte teljes mértékben mentesek maradnak bármiféle kesernyés, komlós befolyástól -, ebbe kapaszkodik aztán a koriander rendkívül pezsdítő karaktere (a fűszerek közül jóformán az egyetlen, mely nyilvánvalóvá válik számomra). Ez a jellemvonás pazarul árnyalja a képet, általa sokkal könnyedebbé és frissebbé alakul át az ízek színezete. Ez esetben tehát egyáltalán nem tűnik erőltetettnek, vagy olcsónak, külön életet élőnek, vagy rendszeridegennek a fűszer jelenléte, fantasztikusan simul bele a környezetbe, az ízek folytatójának nagyszerű szerepét tölti be. Az alkohol ennél kissé harsányabban van jelen melengető hatásával, ami viszont részemről teljesen elfogadható jellegzetesség, ameddig az ennek ellentétéhez vezető út határvonalát nem lépi át és stílusos tud maradni. Ez esetben ez így is történt, lényegében az egyébként is karakteres ital pátoszát erősítve. Örömmel fogyasztanám máskor is.
Dark brown color with decent head. Taste of caramel, liqueur, chocolate, some alcohol warmth at the end. Very balanced beer with excellent impression.

1 coriander, oak, and a caramel sweetness 2 mahogany red with a tan head that lingers, clear 3 dark malt flavors, munich, with more oak flavor and long boil caramel 4 medium body with a medium carbonation and some astringency (low) 5 overall a tasty malty beer with a good oak balance, a good sipping beer

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2014 Couleur ambrée très sombre, très légère mousse beige. Nez sucre caramelisé, fruits noirs ( note vanillée) . Gout leger caramel, fruits noirs, sucre, forte figues, bien balancé et leger en bouche. Fin de bouche note de reglisse, figues.
Nice scotch ale esque maltiness with fruitiness and caramel or toffee. Spice note very prominent, makes it sorta desertlike, but without a sickeningly saccharine character. Really tasty stuff.

BBD June 2018. Pours almost as dark as a stout, but has a very deep dark ruby hue. Nice head and lacing that retains well. The nose is dark fruits (dates, raisins and figs) coupled with hints of vanilla, oak, anise and coriander over a rich malt sweetness. Full bodied with a rich luxurious creamy texture. Normal carbonation with a bit of effervescence on the finish. The outstanding flavor profile is both complex and balanced. It follows the nose with dark fruits slowly yielding to the sweet malt. In the middle chocolate notes are evident that slowly fade to a very subtle vanilla and smoky oak. The finish leaves you with a note of coriander and the only hint of alcohol. In short, this is a brewers masterpiece.

33cl bottle. Pours very dark red, almost black in the glass with a quickly disappearing beige head. Smell is roasted malts, caramel, molasses, plums, light soy sauce aroma, some alcohol. Taste is similar, some burnt sugar sweetness, light final bitterness. Excellent.

Bottle. Pours a fairly dark brown color with a moderate light tan head on there. Nose is extremely malty, with a lot of caramel and bready-earth tones coming off it. Taste is a little bit sweet and definitely earthy, with just a bit of bread and yeast to it. Creamier and breadier than I would like.
UPDATED: JUL 30, 2014 Eccellente e particolarissima birra! Dolce, dallaroma affumicato e maltato, sembra di assaggiare dello "zabaione liquido". Si avvicina molto ad una barley wine. Da non perdere!

@ Havregatan. Bottle (330 ml) from Kihoskh, Copenhagen (31 DKK). Malty and caramelish, spices, sweet flavor, medium body and oily texture. The finish is quite dry and sweet with fruity and spicy notes.

330ml bottle at home. Pours oily black. Little or no head. Bit of tan in it. Molasses, cherry, honey, blackberry, alcohol and spice on the nose. Flavour is caramel dark fruit syrup sweetness with slick mouthfeel. Slight alcohol hit on the back of throat. Full flavoured body with lasting luscious berry aftertaste. Nice

Appearance: Clear dark brown with ruby highlights and finger thick beige head.
Aroma: Aniseed, spiritous, dried fruit, liquorice, toffee.
Taste: Medium sourness and sweetness with low bitterness.
Palate: Thick fairly smooth texture, light/medium body, average carbonation, lingering dry, burnt toffee, aniseed, fruity, spiritous finish.
Comments: Very good and glass lace.
Toffee, spice and herbal notes. Very sweet initially but backed up with a detectable bitterness. Almost opaque black. Hides the abv well. Delicious.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2017 Bottles from Traquair House brewery shop and Waitrose. Clear ruby body with a thin beige head. Lively carbonation. Light lacing. Aroma of fig, toffee, heather honey and coriander. Flavour of spices, stewed tea, toffee and herbs. Easy drinking for the ABV. Medium body with a sticky mouthfeel. Soft fizz. This reminds me of Westmalles Dubbel.

A lovely beer which seems very old fashioned, and thats quite appropriate, the look and history behind it. I thought there was a sweet tone from various old style laid down fruits, some brown sugar and chocolate. Fine balance between sweet and bitter and a good alcohol strength.

Bottle from Beer Gonzo. Like Thornbridge Bracia, the dark brown / black colour and rapidly disappearing head makes this look somewhat like coca cola. Medium, slightly oily body with light carbonation. Initially malt and dark fruits on the nose, followed by more malt, treacle and spices, and a hint of marmite. Not as complex as Bracia but interesting and drinkable.

Bottle 0.33l at Pivo, Oulu. BBE APR 2022. Colour is deep dark brown with small slightly brownish white head. Aromas and flavours: Dark fruits, raisins, nuts, nice balance of dryness and sweetness, some chocolate and malts. Pretty special.

0,33l bottle. Dark ruby - brown color with quickly disappearing tanned head. Aroma is malty, caramel, toasted malt and spices. Taste is rather sweet with rich maltiness. Full bodied with average carbonation. Alcohol is also notable. Overall its good and complex beer.

11.2 oz bottle. Pours a medium translucent brown with virtually no head retention or lacing. Aroma is malt, caramel, slight note of sweet cacao. Flavor is sweet malt, complex, with slight notes of vanilla and vegetal spiciness at the end. The coriander may have faded slightly?

UPDATED: DEC 24, 2014 Brown with little white foam that quickly disappears. Malty aroma of baked bread, toffee and some species. Medium carbonation. Dry malted teste, full bodied, very spicy with chocolate and coffee touches. Extremely complete, balanced and well finished.
Bottle. Pours a dark brown with an off white head. Light maltiness, grass, caramel aroma. Medium body, medium carb. Spiced rum, coke, toffee, light malt cake, lemon... OK.

Courtesy of Kraddel. Thanks! 33 cl. bottle split by 2 @ Barely legal tasting room. Pours a blackish dark brown with a spotty beige head. Smells of thick black liquorish and quite a bit of sherry with spices and candy. Tastes of way too much black liquorish, thick yeast, oxidation, gravy, bad quality dates, metallic, Basically tastes like a not so good Belgian Christmas beer loaded with black liquorish. Body is thick. I had difficulty finishing my glass. I had high expectations of this one and it was a complete letdown. I am frankly baffled by the high ratings here.

Bottle 
Pours dark , reddish brown 
Smell is sweet , sugary cookies . 
Thin body , very straight forward, famiiar taste ( liquorice ??? ) , toffee , cookies . Low carbo .
Dark red pour, coffee chocolate malt smells, full bodied, taste is boozy, medium carbonation, toffee, nice.
Backlog. Bottle at Green Lion Inn. Dominated by spices and burnt caramel, herbs and sherry-wine.

Pouring a nearly-black dark red, there are aromas of dates and other dark fruits accompanied by a small tan head that quickly dissipates. The body is quite thin but has rich sweet fruit, spices and malt flavour. The short finish with a little warming alcohol makes this something to be savoured.

Bottle shared at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Headless murky brown liquid that smells of date honey, hints of wood, black pepper and moss. Tastes deep and fruity - like cooked fruit. Soft carbonation, full-bodied, long, deep fruity finish. Really tasty.

Bottle from the Trembling Madness Drink Shop, York. Pours mahogany with a nice creamy head. A lovely rich ale with liquorice, chocolate, sherry, raisin and nice warming alcohol. Very nice and easy to drink for the strength.
0.33 simple looking bottle. Nice browny head that lasts for a bit. Taste of banana, nuts and leather. Very pleasant aftertaste.
Bottle 330 ml at Sheridans pub, Zagreb. Pours brown with beige head. Sweet spicy and fruity aroma. Roasted malts, some chocolate, malts and spices flavor. Nice one.

Bouteille de 330 ml achetée dans une SAQ au coût de $4.25. Dégustée le 16 août 2003. Bière noire opaque. Mousse peu, col mince et éphémère. Peu effervescente, bulles fines. Odeur de café prononcée. Douce, assez sucrée, très amère en finale. Goût de café prononcé.

Deep copper colored beer with no head at all. Aroma has liquery, caramelly and vanilla sweetness. Flavor is sweet with liqueur, mämmi with coffeey acidicy. Palate is completely flat and medium full. Finish has practically no bitterness and little alcoho with some syrup. Short aftertaste. Disappointment, feels like a real ale but probably shouldnt be like one?

Bottle. Pours a dark brown color with decent head. Aroma of raisin, dark fruit, bubblegum. Some roasted malt. The oak is quite hidden. Pretty rich and complex.  Medium full body.  Medium sweetness. Below average carbonation. Creamy texture. Pretty good.

500 ml bottle into snifter, bottled on 2/1/2012. Pours crystal clear very dark reddish brown color with a 2 finger dense khaki head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice dense soapy lacing clings on the glass, with some light streaming carbonation. Aromas of big caramel, raisin, cherry, plum, pear, fig, toffee, toast, apple, molasses, oak, brown bread, chocolate, coriander, herbal, light pepper, and yeast earthiness. Incredible aromas with awesome complexity and balance of dark malt, yeast ester, and moderate oak notes; with great strength. Taste of big caramel, raisin, plum, cherry, fig, pear, toast, toffee, apple, oak, brown bread, chocolate, coriander, herbal, light pepper, and yeast earthiness. Lingering notes of caramel, raisin, plum, cherry, fig, pear, toast, toffee, oak, brown bread, light chocolate, herbal, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity of dark malt, yeast ester, and moderate oak flavors; with a great malt/yeast flavor balance and zero cloying sweetness after the finish. Light carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a very smooth and lightly slick/bready mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is well hidden with only a slight warming present after the finish. Overall this is an outstanding scotch ale. All around awesome complexity and balance of dark malt, yeast ester, and moderate oak flavors; and very smooth to sip on for the ABV. A highly enjoyable offering.

An attractive ruby reddish brown beer with a small beige head. Beautiful, unique, complex rounded aroma where everything just comes together seamlessly. Dark fruit. Caramel. Bread Chocolate. Port. Subtle spices. Sweet with a hint of alcohol peeking in. Flavor is a much more subdued version of the aroma. Dark malt and spices. Lighter bodied, a bit thin. Finish is semi dry, a little nutty, some alcohol warmth. A wonderful, interesting, complex, ponderous beer with an aroma that got my hopes up way too high but was a treat none the less.
very sweet, rich, dark fruit aroma. Malt, sugar sweetness, raisins, dates, etc. Taste is similar. Very rich, some spices, smooth, malt, a little fruity, braedy.
33cl, bottled, at home @10°C. Dark amber colour, whitish beige head. Aroma is slight roast and raisins. Flavour is smooth raisins and berries. Very well balanced, tasting beer. Recommend!
Bottle. Thin head that rapidly dissipates. Mahogany body. Nose is cherries, pine, coriander, toast, caramel, blackberry, plum, red wine, wheat, banana. Sweetish. Warming and full bodied.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein sehr dunkel rötlichbraunes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch röstmalzig fruchtig, würzig, Karamell. Geschmack leicht röstmalzig, Gewürze, Karamell, fruchtig.

330ml bottle. Not sure why Ive not rated this before. Had a chance to properly savour it this time. Sweet liquorice of course with a tinge of treacle, ginger and coriander and a lovely sticky mouthfeel. A classic without a doubt.
Dank from a bottle at a bar. Sweet, strong taste that resembles slightly that of a madeira or a port.
Color rojizo oscuro casi negro con espuma beige. Aromas de frutas confitadas y moscatel. En boca es sedosa dulce y muy afrutada con picos ácidos. Muy rica.

330ml bottle form Appellation Wines. Pours dark brown, red tinge. No real head. Aromas are toffee malt and light spice. Taste has lots more toffee, and a strange menthol note. No real bitterness. Good clean finish. Pretty good.
Smooth, a bit sweet. Caramel and malt with brown sugar, raisin, figs, spices. Long rolling finish. Alcohol content is well masked.

Niemal doskonale. Pachnace chalwa i jakimis przyprawami, ale nie zidentyfikowalem ich. W smaku wspaniale. Alkoholowe cieplo, smak czekoladowo piernikowy, troche rodzynek i sliwek w czekoladzie. Slodowa tekstura i niewielka bezowa piana. Przypominalo bardzo dobre piwa abbaye dubbel belgijskie. To piwo smialo mozna polecic milosnika tradycyjnych ale oraz klasztornych piw ciemnych. Finisz wytrawny ale i slodkosc w ustach takze wyczuwalo sie. Wspaniale zrownowazone piwo.
Bottle as shown thanks to Paul! Pours a cloudy brown with beige head that diminishes. The aroma is candy sugar, spice, and caramel. Medium mouthfeel with sugary malt and boozy finish. Good.

Bottle from Terre de Boissons, Coquelles, France. A dark brown coloured pour with a medium beige head on top. Sweet aroma of caramel and prunes. Taste is similar, sweet, prunes (reminds me of school dinner dessert in the 70s), spice, caramel, feels very vintage this one. Very good.

Aroma: ripe dark fruits, forest berries, cassis. Appearance: dark brown/black, medium white to beige head. Taste: medium to heavy sweet. Palate: low carbonation, sweets continue, very pleasant flavours of dark berries, average-long finish, slight bitters at the very end. Overall: this is massive, fantastic Traditional Ale, amazing aroma and palate. Bottle from Beer Hawk, England.

Bottle 33 cl, BBE 04/2023. Pours dark brown in color with a tan head. Raisins, smoky wooden notes and brown sugar in aroma. Later on this turns into a more ripe dark fruity sweet kind of aroma. Salty licorice, light biting peppery spicyness and maltyness in taste. Quite smooth mouthfeel. Light burnt/smoky wood in aftertaste along with salty licorice and vinous notes.

The color is a really dark garnet with a large off-white head, and the aroma blends dark fruit, caramel malts, and a hint of clove. The taste is mildly sour and mildly sweet with a touch of umami, and the palate fuses a slick texture, soft carbonation, medium body, and a malty finish.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2014 Cloudy dark brown, thin brownish head. Medium to full body, soft carbonation. Aroma of caramel, chocolate, nuts, dark fruits. Medium sweet, light bitter taste. Creamy texture, very smooth. Slightly dry finish. Excellent.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2014 Dark brown color, medium sized off-white, maybe even tan head. Berries, raisins, dark fruit, caramel and roasted malt aroma. Pleasantly sweet, not too sweet. Medium body, soft carbonation, creamy texture. Long fruity finish. Great!
(Vrutak/Stella beer to go 0,33l bottle)

33 cl, flaske, 8,0 % ABV, købt hos Høkeren i Ravnsborggade på Nørrebro, 14. feb. 2014.
Ibenholt-farvet og "klar" øl med flygtig mocca-farvet skumtop, ca. 1 cm. 
Duft af tørret frugt, gær og krydderier. 
Dyb, god, krydret og fyldig smag med en lækker bitter/sød eftersmag.
Rund, lækker og cremet mundfølelse med klart justeret kulsyreindhold.
En lækker øl i mellemniveauet ABV-mæssigt. 
Og rent designmæssigt også en smuk øl med æstetisk lækker etiket. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
330ml bottle. Deep copper color. Medium size, brown head, stays. Caramel, sweet, raisins, spicy aroma. Clove, raisins, sweet, ginger, grainy taste. Ginger bread dough like aftertaste.

Bottle. Dark brown reddish. Dark musky leathery old malts, smells a bit like a dusty old book. But in good way, with some sweetness in there also. Full bodied. But easy to deink. Dark bready malts, dark fruits. Enjoyable brew.
Delicious, somewhat sweet dark brew. Flavors or fig, raisin and molasses.. even some sourness like sour plums as it warms up. Great beer!

Appearance: Dark murky brown with a skin of bubbly tan head. Flavor: Coriander and fig; man this stuff is like liquid Fig Newton. Chocolate and bourbon is very light. Palate: Light body, creamy texture, flat carbonation, long finish. Very pleasant on the palate. Overall: A fascinating beer with Trappist leaning

Una piacevole scoperta, questa birra tradizionale scozzese. Molto ricca e interessante, anche se la sensazione oleosa e la rilevante presenza della nota alcolica possono stancare. Il gusto è complesso, con note di frutta scura e bacche che si confondono con una pervasiva speziatura.

robe brune aux reflets rouges, peu de carbo et col tres fin qui laisse une belle dentelle.
Arôme majeur de caramel, ensuite des notes boisées avec une touche de rhum et de fruits noirs. 
Tres belle rondeur en bouche sur un mélange dépices et de raisins sec et/ou figues.
Tres bel équilibre et bonne longueur.
Un régal.
Pours dark brown with a khaki head. Aroma is roast, hint of smoke, coriander and floral. Taste is sweet with an almost acrid bitterness. Medium bodied, smooth and well rounded. Excellent.

Spicy, smoky beer, pours dark cola brown with thin fizzy head. Aroma is sweet and floral, taste is more earthy, peat, wooden. Some of the coriander comes through on the palate. Complex beer, but very good.

Pours a dark brown close to black and yields the same colored body, the head was about a slim fingers worth of white foaminess, lacing is adequate and graces the sides of the glass in a spider web sort of fashion; the smell is a rich sort of sweet somewhat cherished coriander-ish aroma, it wants to creep up on ya with some odd oaky molasses that ends up shouldering into some dark fruit but for the most part, they pretty much stay subdued; I do get some black licorice coming through as well; the taste has a rich sweetness in there and then the spicy coriander comes through to help to balance it just a bit, there is some black licorice as well; am I getting a "whiskey" sort of background in the taste - in my opinion, I think so, slightly sweet molasses aftertaste and that leads into a super dry molasses finish; on the palate, well, its not as easy as some might want it to be, but its not too heavy, however, there is a decent coating of black licorice penetrating the mouth and tongue; overall, I would say a pretty good Scotch Ale that I would have again especially with that coriander coming out to add a slight spice - nice night cap

Poured from 33cl bottle. Very dark reddish brown with dissipating beige head. Aroma of caramel, prune, fig. Dark fruits are there, but light. Alcohol is mostly masked. Body is light and creamy and works well.

UPDATED: APR 14, 2015 Small bottle. Dark brown body with a reddish hue. Medium tall but firm and creamy head. Aroma has toffee, prunes, rum, blackcurrant, mild spices. Taste has got the same, accompanied by a rich oily mouthfeel. Great balance. Reminds me a lot of the great Rochefort offerings - its thick and dark like the "10" but with much less alcohol heat, just as smooth as the "6". Re-rate: I get heavy coriander now, didnt get nearly as much on the first time. But this is nice and will not affect the score.

Botella de 33 cl en el Lúpulo Septiembre de 2012. Bueno esto ya es otra cosa,,,, la mejor de las tres de esta casa que he tomado hasta el momento. Gran potencia alcohólica muy bien integrada con el cuerpo medio - fuerte que presenta la cerveza. Color negro con espuma oscura no muy persistente. Sabores menos herbáceos y maltas tostadas y quemadas combinados perfectamente con una densidad muy interesante. Olor penetrante especiado con algo de tostado. Para repetir sin problema una y otra vez mas.
---Me traduzco la etiqueta con la historia de las puertas de la cervecera---Las famosas puertas del oso que custodiaban la aproximación a Traquair House, cerca de Playa de piedras, se han cerrado desde 1745 - cuando la última persona en pasar a través de ellas era Bonnie Prince Charlie.
Ahora, 250 años después, la antigua Brew House Traquair celebra la causa jacobita al producir esta cerveza especiada potente para una receta bien tradicional. Beba despacio y recuerde el viejo brindis por el "Rey de Oer el agua."

Une mousse qui se résorbe en un mince voile au-dessus dun liquide brun aux reflets rouges. Le caramel est le premier à signaler au nez. Ensuite, il y a du malt, des effluves boisées, de tourbière avec de subtiles vapeurs dalcool mêlées avec des raisins secs. En bouche, cest un savant mélange dépices et dherbes qui laisse une impression de minceur, mais un espèce de crescendo gustatif nous surprend, avec un certain délai, envahissant du coup le palais. M.A. avril 2023 (903-231113)
From a bottle. Very nice winter ale. Caramel, light spice toffee, round mouthfeel but not over the top.
~This review was made some time ago via another application, and thus the specific details (beyond numerical scores) are no longer available~

Bouteille 33cl, BB 12/2022.
Couleur acajou-brune, col beige pas très tenace.
Arôme est fruité noir; date et raisin avec un bouquet farineux. Pointe de noisette sur un léger malt biscuité. Fine note de sucre caramélisé.
Palais fruité noir, sucre brun, léger caramel. Fruité noir tirant sur la figue et raisin sec, cerise noire.
