Profil reste très anglais, le tout rondement bien brassée. Mat cara assez sec, pointe de chocolaté, touche dépice et peut-être une note de réglisse?
Fini sec et râpeux.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours reddish-brown with a tan head. Taste sweet, chocolate, floral. I thought this was good. I would drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: Peppery with a slight caramel aroma,
Appearance: clear red brown color with small beige head. Good lacing. Taste: light and smooth. Notes of caramel. Medium carbonation.

Aroma: Strong coriander presence, bourbon oak, chocolate, some fig. Appearance: Dark murky brown with a skin of bubbly tan head. Flavor: Coriander and fig; man this stuff is like liquid Fig Newton. Chocolate and bourbon is very light. Palate: Light body, creamy texture, flat carbonation, long finish. Very pleasant on the palate. Overall: A fascinating beer with Trappist leanings.

Bottle on the train from Thurso to Inverness, from Tomlinsons, 20/10/13.
Dark mahogony brown with a thin light tan covering.
Nose is treacle toffee, dates, dark fruit skins, leather, cake mix, dark malts, pinch of spice.
Taste comprises dates, brown sugars, raw cake mix, candied orange peel, spice.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, light booze in the finish.
Decent enough stuff, the 8% alcohol is well integrated, could carry a bit mroe depth of flavour though - all a bit cake mix!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
Flaska på Ölrepubliken. 
Mycket fin kopparton. Sagolik blandning av malt. Humle och en multitud av goda smaker. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
En super skotsk ale, der har en vidunderlig humle- og maltkarakter. Kan varmt anbefales.

Duftet süßlich-malzig, röstig mit frischen Zitrusnoten. Antrunk süßlich, malzröstig. danach röstig, würzig, Beeren, Schokolade. Im Hintergrund Zitrusnoten. Abgang bitter, stark röstig, schokoladig. Sehr gut.

bruin/rood, helder met schuimige bruike kraag
aroma: zoet, chocolade, mout, caramout, gebrande mouten
smaken: redelijk zoet, zwak bitter, ster, matig fruitig, steranijs, rozijn, laurier,mocca,
volle body, vettig, laag co2, afdronk zoetig, goed gebalanceerd, complex bier !
stijl á la de winter/kerstbieren.

Bottle @ Corso ADB 2013. Colore ramato carico, tendente quasi al marrone con riflessi rubino. Schiuma beige fine e poco persistente. Profumo intenso, abbastanza persistente. Fruttato, principalmente frutti rossi, alcool (sherry), liquirizia, frutta secca, fichi e prugne disidratate. Molto complessa. Gusto intenso, abbastanza persistente. Dolce quasi amabile. Interessantissima la luppolatura, molto elegante, poco marcata: rende la birra decisamente equilibrata. I profumi ricordano le strong ale belghe, è sorprendente. Abbastanza corposa, poco secca non è una birra dissetante, anzi, è più consigliabile berla dopo pasto oppure per stemperare gusti di formaggi decisi e caratterizzati.

Pours red brown with off white fizz. Mild aroma of toasted bread and sweet malts and a hint of wood. Nice sweet malty flavor. Almost no hops sweet lightly fruity red grape apple with rich roasted grains, not quite chocolaty more bready and rich barley malt but not barelywineish. Crisp and nutty it finishes with a hint of wood and the bitter sweet grains.

Poured from bottle to glass. Clear brown with a reddish hue and tan head that dissipated relatively quickly. Aroma is corriander, orange, citrus, sugar, caramel, vanilla, slight roast malt and a tad oaky. Mouthfeel is nice with a light body and moderate carbonation. Sweet initially with a slight CO2 bite with a heavyily lingering corriander essence that lingers. Overall, this is an interesting brew but comes accross as a bit watery.

Dark, dark red almost black in color. White head. Not much smell , maybe alittle sweetness. Very well balanced. The dark color doesn't translate over to the taste. It tastes light, citrusy, orange, and earthy. Overall very good sessionable 8 percent beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 20, 2014 Bottle at "le sur mesure" in Nantes. Dark red/brown pour with little head. Very aromatic. Coffee, chocolate, malt, coriander, nutmeg, citrus, booze. Bordering on full bodied with soft carbonation. Very flavoursome with the above all present and nicely balanced. Medium carbonation and boozy, not too much so however. N

Bottle from Corral in WR. Quite dark with some reddish tints. A two finger tan head fades buts not completely. Fruit and some spice in the nose. The flavor is pretty much the same. The feel is kind of creamy powder. I taste figs, apples, spices, must, molasses, and big malts. This is generally sweet with little bitterness or hops noted. Alcohol is not tasted. An interesting beer and a tasty one, too.

From a 500 ml bottle shared in Avon, NC. Pours a clear cola brown with an ecru head. Aroma of caramel and raisins. Flavor includes some licorice and dark red cherries. Medium bodied. Moderate carbonation. Slightly bitter finish.

Bottle, 33cl - Clear deep red brown beer with a small beige head. Aroma is malty with notes of nuts, dried fruit, chocolate and oranges. Flavor is malty with notes of molasses, dried apricots, roasted nuts and dark bread. Full bodied and sell balanced.
A strange and complex beer, resembling light ales and stouts at the same time.

Dunkelrot/braun, schöne weisse schaumkrone, aroma metallic und dunkle früchte, antrunk süsslich fruchtig, feine rezenz, mässig schlank, fruchtig im Abang, kaum bittere

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @ Les Fleurs du Malt, Lyon. What irony that I should come across this famous English traditional ale in a pub in France... :-) Pours a deep brown-amber body with a small off-white head. Aroma is dates, figs, raisins, dark malts, hints of biscuits and brown sugar. Taste is figs, brown sugar, dates, deep malts, hints of grains and candied apples. Full body, medium carbonation. Solid traditional ale from Traquir.
Bottle from the cave great Western Road Glasgow a deep reddish brown ale with flavous og liquorice coffee and fermented fruit decent ale with sweet finish
33 cl bottle from somewhere. Pours brown withalight beige fluffy head.Aroma of caramel and diacetyl. Too sweet and a strange taste to this highly rated beer.
Bottle purchased at Randall's in St. Louis. Pours brown. Caramel and toffee. Licorice. Somewhat sweet other. Slightly bitter finish. Very nice beer.

Dark red/brown pour with little head. Very aromatic. Coffee, chocolate, malt, coriander, nutmeg, citrus, booze. Bordering on full bodied with soft carbonation. Very flavoursome with the above all present and nicely balanced. Medium carbonation and boozy, not too much so however.

Great beer.
@Volby ølmesse. A nice fruity flavor with a hint of cognac. A slight flat mouthfeel. Color is reddish brown with a light brown head.

Dark fruit/berries, resinous, nuances of choc/coffee, dark malts, herbal notes, light bitter finish. Very good.
Bottle. Pour is deep brown fading to amber, thin tan head. Aroma is very malty, molasses, slight chocolate, lemon. Taste is roasted malt, a little yeast, slight hops, a little sour.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Ølmesse. Dark brown/reddish colour with a light brown head. Malty and fruity aroma with notes of chocolate and coffee. Malty taste with coriander, herbal. plum, chocolate and some coffee. Very nice smooth mouthfeel. Soft carbonation. Good light bitter finish. Great beer.

Bottle. Pours deep red with a very shortlived light brown head. Aroma is of malt, caramel and fruits. Taste is of malt, caramel, darker fruits, spices and notes of citrus and portwine. Very smooth and a bit sweet. Has a portwine-like finish with a bit of alcohos burn. Very good beer.
Bottle bought in Osaka. Pours very dark with an off-white bubbly head. Aroma has caramel, spice, malt and burnt notes. Mirrored in the taste. Slightly sweet with some alcohol.

Bottle from Vika enjoyed at home
Pours brown, quite dark in glass, light tanned big bubbled head. Smells of caramel, burned malts, anise, other spices and hints of diacetyl. Moderate to medium sweet, quite malty, toast, burned caramel and spices, some toffee. Moderate bitter finish. Quite interesting, nice malt base. Maybe to much caramel flavor for me
Takes a while to open up but roasty spices and sweet malts, its pretty good and has aged a bit

Appearance: Very dark, some orange-red highlights. Speckled tan head. Minimal lacing.

Aroma: Chocolate / coffee forward, spices such as nutmeg, coriander, cinnamon, and maybe cardamom. Little bit of orange peel and Cointreau.

Taste: Chocolate and coffee again. Orange peel and nutmeg. Very malt-forward, but not too sweet. Some flowery and herbal characteristics.

Mouthfeel: Medium-heavy body and low carbonation. Holds its heat quite well. Very refreshing beer for its weight.

Overall: Somehow, this manages to be light and refreshing, whilst also complex and strong. The spices are very well blended, and the malt is well balanced with the bitterness. There is not really much about this beer that can be criticised, although perhaps there is a tad too much coriander and possibly a little *too* refreshing for a wee heavy.
Aroma of spicy chocolate with a hint of orange and a touch of warming alcohol. Flavour adds some gentle roasty notes but mostly mirrors the aroma

At Epic Beer Fest 2013. Clear dark nutty copper. Aroma is dark malty and peaty with a sticky toffee malt under it. Flavor is the same, and very tasty. Dark malt earthy sweetness, toffee, peat, toast, and a light kiss of molasses.

Bottle. Pours a very dark brown with off white head, settles quickly with minimal lacing. Aroma is strong coriander, clove, herbal, tea, anise, slight fruity, citrus character, strong raisin as it warms. Flavor is strong coriander, tea, herbal, floral, with a fruity finish, dates, plum, fig, apricot, mild licorice. Fairly sweet throughout, very pleasant. Soft carbonation, medium body, and mildly juicy, sticky texture. A pleasant, herbal, traditional ale.

Poured from bottle at Eulogy. Came highly recommended by the bartender as as special beer from the oldedt brewery in Scotland. It is aged in oak barrels where tgst species of oak no longer exists. The brewery has out lasted the tree. Taste improves as it warms. Wonderful aroma from this dark physically warming beer. Very smooth, goes down easy.

UPDATED: JUL 24, 2013 Deep ruby red with an off-white, quickly diminishing head. Mild aroma of berries, caramel, toffee, malt. Taste is sweet, with a medium-lasting, light bitter finish. Oily texture, full body, light-medium carbonation. Good beer.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Head: beige foam. Colour: clear, purple-black. Aroma: spicy. Taste: medium bitter-sweet, Palate: smooth, medium bitter-sweet body, medium CO2. Overall; very nice

Bottle @ DØE tasting. Pours dark amber with a offwhite head. Aroma of malt, caramel, berries, dark fruit. Flavor is malt, caramel, dark chocolate, berries, dark fruit, cinnamon. Medium body, soft carbonation, light warming alcohol. 170713

2/VII/13 - 33cl bottle @ home - BB: II/2020 (2013-601) Thanks to Erwin for sharing the bottle!
Clear purple brown beer, irregular beige head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: floral, some chocolate, shampoo, bit spicy, more chocolate. MF: soft carbon, medium to full body. Taste: bit spicy, floral, cocoa powder, some caramel, little soapy. Aftertaste: chocolate, spicy, soapy bitterness, weird spices, little sweet, caramel, red fruit jam. Did not like. Overhyped??
(bottle 17/07-2013) low beige head, light sweet aroma, clear brown color, soft co2, smooth vintage taste, full body.

Bottle @ døe øl smagning, 17 / 7 2013. Dark clear brown, small white head, some lacing that doesnt last. Aroma, at first flower-like perfume, sweet spicy, roasted malts. Taste, roasted malts, spicy, dark fruits. Leaves bitter aftertaste. Feels good in the mouth, hides the 8% really well.
Nice tasting Belgium style beer very malty hoppy and wheaty beers. Rich and full of taste.

Bottled, 0.33l. Clear red brown color with small brownish head, virtually no lacing and average visible carbonation. Aroma of toasted malt, nuts, caramel, moderate yeast, floral hops, oak wood and scotch. Taste start sweet and rich malty, then followed by sourish dark fruits, warm alcoholic and spicy mouthfeel with poor bitterness in the finish. Full body, thick oily texture and soft carbonation in palate. Very rich aroma and taste, while on the other hand, alcohol strength gets you quickly drunk...
Bottle from Philly Beer and Steak. Shared with Stegosaurus. Nice blend of caramel malt, chocolate and spice. Strong oak, sweet and spice finish. It was good...bold.
Flaske fra Vinmonopolet.mørk brun farge,, medium til lavt karbonert, tynt skum. Mye maltsmak, gjær, karamell, nellik,nøtter, rosin, tre, brød,krydder, urter. En særdeles god øl

330ml bottle from Beer Hawk - Deep dark red body, short-lived thin froth. Nose is berries, cake fruit, sweet caramel, ripe black cherries. Taste is rich and robust, thick and syrupy, with a warm boozy kick. Very good indeed.
Misty ruby colored body with a small dense beige head. Rock sugar, boozy, fruity spicy liqueur and raisins on the nose. Sweet and alco warm, fruity and full bodied. Suiting carbonation.
Bottle from Wegmans Williamsport. Pours black with a half inch of khaki foam. Lots of oak on the nose. Tastes like coca cola on the tongue. Hides its alcohol well. An easy sipper.

Served at Bier Markt Esplanade in Toronto, after a Jays victory in 2011, with my Bautista ball in hand. This gem was served in an english pint glass. Pours a dark reddish brown color. thin head. Unreal aroma of ripened berries, roasted plums,chocolate, caramel. Lots of malt character present, tempered with a spiciness (coriander, clove, nutmeg?). Blown away, this rivals a fine single malt in depth of character and complexity. A 5.5 from me, and a fine tribute to Bonnie Prince Charlie, the king oer the water

Poured out of a bottle. A: dark caramel, fig, slight spice. Nice oxidized aged note. Smell rich. A: a dark brown. Transparent and bright. Head was white but fell quickly. T: slightly sweet, touch of cardboard oxidized note. Dark caramel, fig, red grape, bready like almost rye bread, toffe, slight bitterness, maybe a peatieness? A very subdued coriander tang that makes a nice cut through the richness. It makes your mouth water a little bit. P: easy to drink. Watery yet viscous mouthfeel. Doesnt coat but flavors stay with with you for awhile. O: good beer I like that they aged it. The rich flavors are nicely cut short with the coriander tang and bitterness. Good lightfeeling sipper.
Dark ruby with smal head. Aroma dark fruits, caramel, malt. Taste sweet candy malt, dark fruits, some bitter mocha. Full body, text smooth, low carb. A bit thin in aroma and taste.

Not overly impressed. Aroma was strong sweet malts like molasses. Dark color that was murky with a small head. Palate was syrupy by not necessarily pleasant. Sweet flavor, almost like thinned out malt extract. The corriander did not really stand out. Burnt sugar and other spices were present. Complex but not something I will visit again anytime soon.

Bottle at home in London with Lyoli - picked up at Royal Mile Whiskies, London. Pours clear russet with a moderate, frothy off-white head. Good malty nose, some sweet and ripe fruits, a bit of bread, berries. Medium sweet flavor, some semi-dried berries, bready malts, subtle spices. Medium bodied with fine, massaging carbonation. Sweet finish, plenty more malty sweetness, toasty bread, slight warming alcohol, berries, spruce. Delicious beer, and drinks like a dream for the ABV. This would be a really dangerous sessioner.

Bottle.  Pours a slightly reddish dark brown with a small off-white head.  Aroma is spice-mostly coriander, maple, caramel, bread, bubblegum.  Taste is medium sweet, light bitter, lots of spice.  Finish is dry.  Medium-full body, soft carbonation.  Solid and unique.

Bottle 33 cl from Bier-Bienne (CH). Dark brown with purple refections, average cream head. Spiced aromas, malt, leather, choc, hints of old Porto. The taste is soft and unctuous, malted wealth, a little syrupy with caramel-molasses. Spiced with notes of ginger, coriander, orange, choc and dry fruits. A very complex beer which is a discovery with every sip.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2014 Fra flaske på Tap1 mai-13: for et knapt år siden ga jeg Traquair House Ale 4.4, og denne er i samme liga. Balansert, kompleks, lettdrikkelig med en smak og aroma av blåbær, korinter, lakris innpakket i en kledelig tørrhet. Rund og bløt, som å brette en edderdunsdyne over seg. Herlig. Flaske delt med Ovesen på Holmens aktivitetsdag 1.mai: de 4.4 er fullt fortjent, dette er et øl i særklasse. Skal kytes i godt lag, i små slurker fra elegante glass.
UPDATED: MAY 1, 2014 Dark ruby. Beige head. Wonderful round stout aroma. Smooth, complex and well-balanced taste with hints of prunes. A marvellous beer!
Bottle consumed at Barrel & Grain.  Brown pour with an off whites head. Coriander aromas?  Big sweet malty notes with oak and floral undercurrents. Good body, balance, and mouthfeel.

Birra veramente atipica, considerato il luogo dove ha origine.
Già laroma è complesso e ricco, si distinguono caramello, cioccolato e spezie.
Classico e celtico è invece laspetto, con un bel bruno opaco; scarsa la schiuma.
Corpo possente, sapori articolati di caramello, cioccolato, aromi di tostatura e forse anche nocciola; il tutto comunque molto ben bilanciato.
Finale quasi dolciastro ed alcolico, lascia un ottimo e persistente retrogusto.
Il dolce del malto e lelevato corpo rappresentano unanomalia nel variegato panorama delle birre doltremanica. Anomalia che, per il mio personalissimo gusto, è apprezzatissima. --------  Beer really atypical, considered the place where it originated.
Even the aroma is complex and rich, stand caramel, chocolate and spices.
Classical and Celtic is the aspect, with a beautiful brown opaque low foam.
Powerful body, articulated flavors of caramel, chocolate, aromas of toasted hazelnut and perhaps, all still very well balanced.
Final almost sweet and alcoholic, and leaves a great lingering aftertaste.
The malty sweetness and high body represent an anomaly in the varied landscape of the beers of the channel. Anomaly, for my personal taste, it is appreciated.

A - Pours a dark brown/red body with a quickly fading tan head.

S - Earthy chocolate, dense caramel, brown sugar, toffee flavored cotton candy, sorghum, raisins.

T - Toasted brown sugar, molasses, toffee, caramel, vanilla, hints of chocolate, the coriander adds a good "non sweet" layer that helps with balance. Finishes with a hint of bitterness.

Caramel, toffee and molasses are the stars of the show but dont wear out their welcome. Everything melds very well. This is what I want out of a Scotch Ale.

Serving type: bottle

10-04-2011
Bottle from Slowbeer. great beer. Aromas of chocolate, vanilla, caramel. Taste is sweet, with bitter notes, and very long length. Palate is creamy, and full bodied. Black, with a frothy head.

Clear, deep copper body with a small off-white head that ends up as a thin film quite fast, fair lacing. The aroma is strong, very pleasant and hey! Jingle bells, jingle bells! I get lots of christmassy spices blended with delicious notes of dark dried fruits like raisins. Lovely! The taste is moderate sweet with a long-lasting light bitter finish.  Strong, complex and pleasant malt-driven flavour profile. The christmas spices are in the front, anise-like liquorice, dried dark fruits, caramel and some well masked vinous notes in the back. Full body, oily to syrupy texture and very soft carbonation. A lovely beer, I think I need to save some bottles for christmas! 
[33 cl bottle, enjoyed 8 years before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Vika, Oslo]
Brown small off white head. Aroma: candy, caramel, bisquits. Taste, sweet caramel, some boozy. (bad notes..need to revisit) Nice!
Full black ale with a small white head. Smooth palate and nice aroma and taste of mocca. Long lasting taste. Very good beer.
Vollmundig malziger Antrunk, dennoch erfrischend, leicht schokoladig, dezente Hintergrundsäure. Süffig, würzig, etwas Hopfen. Zum Ende hin schokoladiger, harmonisch. 11/12/12/12/9/12

A dark, reddish-brown coloured beer with a weak, white head. The initial smell is rich, meaty and spicy, loads of dark malt aromas and slightly floral. Was compared to Worcester Sauce! Fizzy but rich mouthfeel. The taste is bitter-sweet, rich dark malts give a smooth sweetness of burnt sugar, liquorice and the bitterness of roasted nuts. Then the meatiness of yeasty Marmite brings a slightly sour, grassy flavour. The sour element lingers well into the finish, accompanied by the smooth, rich sweetness.
not a fan. way too sweet, like harsh belgian ale. lots of plum, brown sugar, some dates and cherry. bleh. not for me.
Smak och doft av humle, malt, karamell, smörkola. Rund och len med en trevlig beska. Välbalanserad.

Nose is salty licqourice , plums, dark fruit and a touch of caramel. Taste is very malty, plums, spices, cola, touch of nut, finish is bitter, rich dark fruits and is lasting.

A very nice beer.

Bottle from Chesters Beers of the World. Pours wonderfully dark with a hint of ruby red--minimal head. Wonderfully robust beer that has an excellent palate. Full bodied taste with lots of dark fruits: plums, currants, dates. Delicious.
Pours large ruby head that lasts. Sweet toasted malts aroma with hints of perfumy hops. Excellent toasted caramel malts with a tad alcohol background.

0.33ml bottle from Liberty Wines. Served in a chalice. Appearance: Opaque black with a tiny brown head. Aroma: Caramel, dough, raisins, and something else I cant place. Palate: Thick bodied, syrupy, fizzy, long finish that gets slightly dry. Taste: Very sweet. Slightly roasty in the finish.

I feel obliged to begin this review with a little history. I have a particular affinity for this beer based on name alone. The whole reason I exist is because my Jacobite ancestor was booted out of Scotland in the 1600s. He settled in Goochland, VA and the rest is history--literally. 

The beer pours a gorgeous clear, dark ruby-amber color. Its not just clear. It is like a colored, solid glass paper weight. Imagine how light looks when it passes through an object like that. It has a light taupe colored head. The head consists of the microbubbles often seen in nitro-infused beers. The aroma is mild, but rich with toffee and sorghum. The mouthfeel is medium- to full-bodied, wet, and slick. A bit dry on the finish, but only enough to balance things. Sweet sorghum emerges first with faint lemongrass coming in late. I dont pick up the corriander, but this beer seems to be all about balance. So it could just be absorbed into the overall expression of flavor. Its very drinkable and a nicely engineered beer.

Bottle.  Pours a dark amber color with a small head that fades normally.  Very nice and complex aroma.  Getting chocolate, figs, blueberries, raisins, caramel, wood, and plums.  Taste is a bit of a let down based on the aroma.  Starts off sweet with dark fruits and blueberries but after that its a bit off.  Lots of coriander overpowers the other very pleasant aromas.  I dont get any chocolate or caramel in the taste.  Finish is smooth though, lingering raisins, coriander and plums.  Overall, its still pretty decent.  Love the aroma, nice thick mouthfeel, but it just doesnt all come together well.

A thin head on a dark brown body.
The aroma is woody, deep and with black licorice.
The taste is oak, alcohol, lemon, moderate to strong malt sweetness and more wood.
The texture is crisp with a lighter body and moderate carbonation.
This is an interesting ale, worth trying.
220313. Bottle at Tuulensuu, Tampere. Pours dark brown with a small head. Aroma licorice, plums. Sweet raisin taste. Full bodied. Not Bad.

0.33l bottle. This one pours a deep ruby-brown body with a nice medium sized both bubbly, creamy and lacing beige top. Its lovely dark fruity on the aroma, sweet and some what consentrated. I get raisins, some sweet licorice and traces of nuts. Not bad at all. Not extreme, but quite nice. Oh, yeah. This is a tasty little thing. Its gentle and soft on the carbonation and the mouthfeel is quite slick. Salmiac liquorice pastilles, herbal honey, sweet licorice, something slightly burned and wet-rocky before a peppery - almost chili-like slightly burned spicy aftertaste kicks in. Impressive stuff. A nice combination of many many things this. 19.01.2013

Bottle shared at beers of the world.  Aroma is wood varnish, corriander and other spices.  Pours deep brown with a nice fizzy head.  Taste is heavy on the spice and coriander.  This works really well with the fruity malt back.  Big tast on this one.  Big fan.

Dark reddish brown color, good head formation. Strong deep malty aroma, caramel and dark fruits. Thickish palate, dark malt, prune and plum fruitiness. Light hop bitterness, nice drying spicy touch (although I wouldnt have guessed coriander if it wasnt written on the bottle. Great complexity and hearty warming feel.

Bottle at inez, tampere. Hazy dark brown color, almost black. Sweet licorice aroma, raisin, little alcohol, roasty malts. Sweet roasty and licorice, medium bodied and balanced. Sweet roasty finish, hint of alcohol.
One of the best traditional ales. Good and powerful aroma, cloudy appearance, liqueur taste and palate. Decent, memorable. Rated from the bottle. Highly recommended.

Reviewed 1/31/13. 16.9 oz bottle into a Duvel tulip.

A: Pours a very dark burgundy color. The head is a one finger eggshell shade with short retention. A small collar is left around the edges of the glass, as well.

S: Extremely dark fruit forward. Raisins, plums, cherries, figs, caramel, chocolate, molasses, licorice, and coriander are all on the nose at varying points. A budding oak quality comes out as it warms some. I really like the integration between both the sweet and herbal aspects.

T: At first, its vaguely chocolaty, but it seems like the opening flavors arent too impressive. If anything, this really picks up after the midtaste, where the dark fruit character becomes quite strong. Its finish sees a return of the chocolate notes, some molasses, pumpernickel bread, and a toffee quality almost reminiscent of a doppelbock. The distant aftertaste is where the coriander goes from being integrated within the caramel malt sweetness to being its own distinct note. In lieu of hops, the coriander and oak properties nicely balances the malty base.

M: Not as sweet or as syrupy as I expected (thankfully). The oak does a good job of drying out the finish some - unfortunately it has too much influence on the texture, rendering it a bit insubstantial feeling and excessively tannic. The dry, abrupt end gives it excellent drinkability, at the cost of some complexity and richness - but it also cuts down the sweetness admirably. Its a wash, really.

O: I didnt expect to finish this one so quickly. Its the exact same problem I had with Sucaba - Im amazed at how fast I can kill a bottle of it, but I cant help but want this to be a more decadent and savorable treat with less barrel influence. Still, despite my complaints, this is a very good offering.

Pours a nice dark brown, with slight head but sticks around for a while. The aroma is somewhat on the sweeter side but with hints of chocolate and coffee barley. Taste is also sweeter, very belgian type but with a distinct aftertaste. A very soft and well balanced and rounded body... A very drinkable beer, recomended for fans of strong belgian type beers.
Bottle. Very dark mahogany with small tan head. All kinds of aromas and flavors. Chocolate, caramel, candy, sugar...just kept going.

Pours a clear dark cola color with a light tan head that is robust, but settles down fairly quickly.  Earthy peat aroma.  Taste is sweet roasted malt, toffee, as well as mild notes of coffee and chocolate. Slight warmth due to the 8% ABV.  Very good, but not exceptional over others of similar style.

Very deep brown color, almost black, with a tiny head which fastly disappears. Warm aromas to cherries, pears, sweet fruit, cola and some toasted malts. Sweet flavour, tastes like liquorice, cola, plums, toffee and nuts. Rich, delicious and original. Superb.

Bottle (from tasting session notes). Aroma has some aged character, sweet pears, and alcohol fumes. Flavors are smooth, with hints of candy, Coke, aand tea. Aftertaste is very smooth, vinous, and pear-like. Subtle but well balanced.

Bottle. Pours very dark brown, with a small creamy head. Aroma is burned malts and wood, with dark fruits, nuts and coffee, as well as grain, molasses and kandi. Full creamy body, with soft carbonation. Flavour is sweet of sugar and succade, with lots of burned malts and molasses making this a dark and very heavy beer.
330ml bottle from Appellation Wines. Very dark brown colour, not much head. Sweet cola vegetable aroma. Sweet treacle toffee flavour. Sweet creamy aftertaste. Not really my sort of beer.

On tap in a snifter at Krug Park in Omaha during Beer Week.  Will have to try again to make detailed notes.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a nice dark brown with ruby highlights. A decent khaki colored head with decent lacing.  Aroma of brown sugar and dark fruits with some spiciness.  Taste follows nose with brown sugar, dark fruits and just enough spiciness to make it interesting but not overpowering.  Roasted flavor mid palate with a hint of licorice and booze.  Finishes a little sweet with moderate mouthfeel.  Very nice scotch ale.  Had at Krug Park bar in Omaha during Beer Week 2013.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark brown to black body and flimsy light tan head. Cookies, bay leave, liquorice, toffee, herbal and whiskey. Interesting and different. Thin body yet rich taste combining booze like sweetness, bitter distillate and caramel. Think this would work very well with hearty, meaty cheeses. Not always a fan of these spiced yet fairly thin traditional ales, but this works pretty well. (33cl bottle from Biere Revolution)

Bottle at home. Pours a deep burgundy colour with a beige medium head. Malty aroma of oak, dried fruit, leather, caramelized sugar, some alcohol and chocolate. Very pleasant and balanced. A bit sweet flavours of malty hazel nuts and wood, along with more dried fruits. Has a rich and silky mouthfeel, and a light bitterness. Overall a nice and well-balanced ale. Could not exactly find the spices.

This is even better than their House Ale. At first I was skeptical, as this version had coriander added. But this is really one of the most outstanding ales I have ever consumed. Brewed in honor of the Jacobite revolution, this ale is a worthy competitor to Samuel Smiths Oatmeal Stout, the best brew in the world. Fitting. Do not drink too cold.

0.33 L bottle from Vinmonopolet Nettbutikk. Pours a deep dark reddish brown body. Low dense light brown head. Big malt aroma featuring burnt caramel, molasses and dark bread. Quite spicy. Fine fruit tones, plums, raisins and cherries.  Full malt body. Sweet and peppery with loads of caramel. Some rounded spice tones too, and notes of tinned dark fruits. Soft creamy mouthfeel. Mild bitterness in a spiced and malty finish. A very nice one.

Dark brown with deep red highlights and a tan dissipating head. Not much aroma - a little dark dried fruit. Flavor very similar to the aroma. Definite warm boozy character. Could not pick up coriander in either the aroma or flavor. Ok but not as good as I had remembered.

From a 330ml bottle on 29/1/2013. Pours a very dark amber with a smallish. head. Has a huge malty aroma featuring caramel, toffee and molasses, with a touch of spice. Flavour wise, theres heaps of sweet caramel, brown sugar, dark fruit, molasses, aniseed and a muted spicy bitterness at the back. The texture is relatively creamy. Nice stuff but a little shy of being top flight.
Aroma of raisin and sherry. Pours a dark muddy brown with a mild head. Tastes of raisin, sherry, coriander, and slightly acidic prune. Medium bodied with mild carbonation. Very good beer.

Bottle (330ml for £2.99 from The Cave, Glasgow):

Strong dark fruits on the nose with lots of raisin, plum and figs. There is a lot of brown sugar and some rich malts in the mix too along with a little toffee.
Dark, mahogany brown colour that is almost black in colour and has a thin, half centimetre tall head that is a brownish tan colour. The head is bubbly and fades of a tiny patch of lacing after about thirty seconds.
Sweet malts and some toffee, a great blend of figs and raisin along with numerous other dark fruits that are all quite evenly balanced and work well together. There is some sugar, a bit of spice and some light cocoa as well.
Smooth on the palate with a very sweet feel and medium body. Carbonation is quite low and there is also a slightly boozy feel to it, as expected given the alcohol levels.

Quite complex beer and a strong one at that but it was a very enjoyable on as well. There is a good mix of fruits and sweet malts along with enough alcohol to give the beer a pleasant, boozy kick to it.

This is a fantastic beer.  Opens with a slightly metallic zing, and molasses with a little barley wine. Changes slowly to provide some liquorice, and tiniest hint of vanilla mixed with plums. Gives a bitter sweet finish.

Bottle 0,33 L. Very dark brown colour with some ruby reflections. For a finger big, frothy, light brown head. Aroma is more or less on malty side - cookies, roasted malts, caramel, brown sugar and dried fruits. Full bodied, creamy beer. Taste is light caramely sweet at the start and turns into a light bitter aftertaste with dried fruits notes.
Bottle. Poured a beautiful dark brown with a thick beige head,  aroma: fruits.  Taste was also fruits wit hints of malts. Very nice beer.

Bottle @ Garrison District Ale House in Fredericton, NB Canada. Very excited to find this on the menu.

Opaque amber brown, with thin whispy off-white head, some minimal lacing.
Aroma is a a heavy malty backbone with hints of candied sugar, and strange whiffs of pepper. Body is quite full, leaning towards "pretty chewy" for what it is! Great aftertaste with bits of toast showing through and a mildly warming finish.
Yummy.

Deep brown with a thick tan head.
Scent is soft fruit, apple, raisin....spice.
Taste is caramel, fruit.
Very creamy, dark and smooth.
A very nice ale.

Pours a brown black with a thin head.  Dried fruit and spice in the nose.  Not too different from a lightly spiced mulled wine I had earlier.  Cherries, raisins, a little brown sugar, and citrus aromas. Red wine, with cherries and raisins dominate the flavor.  Some coriander and anise spice near the finish that is both bitter and juicy.  The spice is a little heavy handed but not overdone.  Ok.  I feel like I should heat this up and put it in a mug. Good for a Christmas night.

11.5 bottle from wine and cheese place.  brown color with red hints shinning through.  Head quickly goes away.  Very sweet malt with caramel.  Light carbonation.  Dried fruits, and some spice.  This is a complex beer.  Very drinkable.
bottle @ Astral beers. It pours dark witha a beige head on top. Creamy, fruity, caramel, cocoa, tobacco and many other things. Very complex and rich. Greatly balanced.

Prettty dark brown and certainly more opaque than the House Ale. Super nose. One inch rich rocky head. Soft yet firm on the tongue and fullish with a slightly sweet chocolate element. There is almost like an orangy and brown sugar like quality to the sweetness without being cloying. Never a duff bottle, always such consistenncy batch to batch.
 Tip top.

Exceptional beer.  Medium bodied, dark brown appearance with light brown head.  Fresh roasted malt aroma with a licorice tinge.  Flavor is malty but there is a pronounced spicyness to this beer that propels it above competition.

Pours a hazy dark brown, with a hint of ruby red when the light is put through it, fluffy crema coloured head, aromas are apricots and tonic wine (buckfast) little bit of booze. Taste, is so much going here there's colonial spices, juniper berries amazing!! Nice thick mouthful really good sweet beginning, Loveley bitter spicy middle and trails of perfectly 

via Beer Buddy

Bottle (330 ml). Dark brown with a medium slowly diminishing beige head and nice lacing. Aroma of caramel, coriander, liquorice, roasted malt, smoke and herbal/floral notes. Taste is sweet with the coriander being more present. Theres also a good malty body with dark fruits and caramel notes. Long spicy finish. Mouthfeel is a bit thin and slightly dry the mouth. I usually dont like beer with coriander, but this one if more than acceptable. Interesting brew.

Pours a very dark brown with garnet highlights and a 1 finger, creamy tan head. Aroma is fantastic, intense fruity earthy and floral notes, coriander, juniper, nutmeg, lots of sweet floral and fruity notes, sweet malt, a hint of burnt sugar and citrus. Flavor is equally intense and impressive, tons of spice, molasses, earth, heavy thistle and honeysuckle floral notes, dark fruit, burnt sugar, sweet, earth plant notes, a hint of sweet melon.  Medium body with a creamy to oily feel throughout and light carbonation. I really thoroughly enjoyed this beer. So intense without being overpowering and so unique.
Bottle. Deep brownish-amber with little head. Aroma was sweet, fruit cake. Taste was dried fruit, heavy tasty. Pretty good actually.

33 cl bottle. BBE 01/2019.
Originally rated on 20090523. (9+4+9+4+17)
Pours deep dark ruby red color with a minimal head on the sides. Aroma of ripe fruits like raisins and plums, some herbal notes, hints of licorice and some dark malts, caramel and mild wooden notes as well. Flavor of ripe fruits, sweetish caramel, mild chocolaty malts leads to a faint licorice finish. Some belgian strong ale elements seem to have appeared. Silky smooth palate, some rougher edges have refined in three years, maybe a bit too much though. Still an excellent brew.
3327

2009 Bottle from Capones. Pours merky dark brown. nose is dark dried fruit with cherries dates, plums, corn sugar & boozy liquer and medicinalthe like notes.first sip is brown malty with coriander still strong. finish is dry sherry like.interesting beer.
Bottle. Pours dark brown, some purple. Fizzy brown head that disappears quickly. Nose is dominated by coriander. Taste is coriander, orange peel, and booze. Soft body and carbonation.

33cl bottel @ Silja Line ferry. Poured very dark brown with a thin head. Aroma has sweet fruits all over, strong spicy, plums. Flavor is soaked raisins, plums, sweet licorice, aniseed? Enjoyable, but almost too sweet for me.

Number 50 on Ratebeer. Aroma is Froot Loops, no other way to explain that. It smells very good, a basket of fruit. Appearance is reddish/cola brown. Taste is fruity, maybe some apple, I cant quite pinpoint the fruit. Not very bitter, either. The mouthfeel is carbonated, medium mouthfeel. Overall, I have had better scotch ales, however, this is nothing I would turn down.
Pours dark brown with a creamy head. Very rich and sweet. Again like the House Ale, it has a spicy character to it. Apparently it is spiced with coriander. Nice little brew, and potent!

Bottle shared at a tasting at Ariels place. Pours brown to orange with a beige head, aroma of honey, caramel, toffee richness, wood, chocolate, dark bread, cognac, flavor is caramelish, with some malt, grapes, dark bread and chocolate, medium bodied

Opaque brown color. Spiced fig and date with the coriander on the nose all surrounded by perfume of cloves. Full bodied with more pit fruit, raisin, coriander and a hint of black currant. Soft as a pillow in the mouth. Long, savory finish.
Sample on tap at Bières et saveurs (Chambly). Aroma: banana, caramel, yeast. Taste is sweet, not too heavy. Good balance.
August 30, 2012 bottle at BVerys tasting. Brown pour with some head.  Caramel, chocolate, spice and fruit in the aroma and taste.
Bottle: Brown pour. Aroma of Caramel, clove, coriander, chocolate, and dark fruit like raisins or prunes. Taste is a bit thin but sweet.
Bottle. Brown amber pour with a white head. Caramel, cinnamon, allspice, some sort of sweet fruit that I cant specifically identify - malty and good. Nice brew.

330 ml bottle. Pours a deep red brown with light head which dissipates quickly. Nice full aromas of caramel, roasted malts,and dark ripe fruit. Flavors of malts, toffee, licorise, and spice. Very nice.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Ariels place. Thanks zvikar. Clear brown with shiny red hues. Aroma of malt, caramel, chocolate hints, coriander and some fruitiness. Sweet malty flavor with caramel, chocolate notes, some spiciness and a honey-ish hint. Medium to full-bodied. Pretty nice.

Bottle shared.  Pours clear dark brown with a small tan head.  Aroma of overripe dark fruits, raisins, caramel and prunes.  Flavour is medium to heavy sweet and light moderate bitter.  Medium to full bodied with soft carbonation.

33cl bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis.
Thin tan head.  Raisins in the aroma.  Clear dark amber pour.  Smooth aftertaste.  A lovely brew.

330ml bottle. Very dark brown pour with a small head. Aroma is not strong, but there is some dark fruit, molasses, clove, allspice and cinnamon. Taste is dark malt sweetness and spices. Little cinnamon burn in the body, gives a warming sensation.

Bottle at Tekehtopa
Dark ruby body, disappearing head
Full bodied with a rich aroma of nuts, roast, spices blended with perfection.
Complex taste, red fruits, raisins, belgian spices, roast, coffee. Long lasting dry and bitter aftertaste. A very nice surprise this beer!

Sampled from an 11.2 oz brown bottle this beer poured a murky dark brown color with a medium sized foamy brown head that faded quickly and left minimal lacing. The aroma was cherry cola, anise, lemon and faint notes of malt, wood and cognac. The flavor was tart and bitter with notes of anise, molasses, cherry cola, coriander, pepper, vague herbs, wood and cognac. Nicely complex but the flavors do not really blend overly well. Long finish of anise, molasses, lemon and pepper. Moderately full bodied. Interesting.

Bottle - Rich, malty, hints of cocoa and caramel with a bit of alcohol.  Deep ruby with a small but lasting head.  Chocolate and dark fruits with a bit of bitterness throughout and lasting well after.    Very rich and spicy but I just dont get the coriander.   A nice cold day ale.

Bottled. Says best before 2019.  Deep ruby red, almost opaque with a nice initial tan head and a pleasant ring and surface lace that lasts.  The aroma is a round and full perfume of powdered chocolate and dark berries.  On a velvety and surprisingly light mouthfeel flavors of slightly sour plums, dark hearty bread, and chocolate play with subtle spice and bitterness at the end.  If I wasnt told I might guess this is a high quality belgian dubbel.  Phenomenal beer.
A really well balanced Scottish ale, nice herbal body well balanced with caramel body and smoke notes

Tasting @ Bestway. Thin brown pour. Little to no foam. Thin spicy body. Hints of cherry and coriander. Weak, watery mouth feel. No warming from the high alcohol %. Boring relic of a brew. Imbibed for the experience. Not a winner, IMHO.
From bottle at SIBF. Ruby brown, no head. Sweet syrup, sour age. Sour grape and apple. Nice sweet, dubbel, spiced brown. good

Bottle at SIBF 2012. Dark fruit, spices, and dry wood up front. Smells lovely, but the flavor falls short -- its far too mineraly. Similar to pannepot, but without the full body. Certainly tasty, but not quite what I thought it would be.

33cl bottle at Amundsen. Pours dark brown with a reddish hue and a small off-white head. Fruity aroma with lots of caramel, malt and hints of spices. Quite sweet and caramelly, a bit too much for my liking. Decent beer but not a favourite.
Fine tasting Ale-seemed Belgian in composition, similar to a traditional dubbel. Highly recommended and well above most other Scottish ales.

On bottle at Amundsen.
Dark color, ok foam.
Dried fruit aromas
Sweet, ok balance .
Enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very dark, but still translucent. A medium tan head on this did not last long. First taste impression is of fruits, but backed up by some very rich malts. Nice!
Beautiful scottish beer. Dark copper color. Bredy caramel and toffee taste. It alo has some fruity orange and peppery spice. Its medium bodied, smooth and dry with a hint of ABV heat.

Dark brown with a small grey head. Complex aroma of raisins, caramell, smoke, oak and chocolate. Flavor is yeasty and fun with bright layers of smoke and spices followed by genuine malty nutty chocolate notes and nobel hops. Lovely balanced ale with a nice smooth medium bodied mouthfeel.

Bottle @ home. Deep reddish brown appearance wit ha tan head that dissipates quickly. Fucking weird aroma- you get the coriander and youre like, what the fuck?! Spicy, almost barleywine-like aroma with notes of rich caramel malt, dark chocolate, citrus, and a bit of earth. Fairly low carbonation. Vanilla birthday cake, coriander, rich orange citrusy, dark chocolate, toffee flavor. Weird but strangely fun to drink.
Bottiglia 33 cl. Marrone scuro con schiuma beige fine ma non molto persistente. Naso intenso, persistente e complesso (prugna secca, caffè tostato....). Abboccata, calda, di corpo......buona.....

Fascinating to have this up against the Moon Dog colab of the same style. More spice, cola and licorice but the fruit weight is beefed up with more sweetness and what is heading towards treacle in terms of intensity. Finish is weak relative to the mid palate but no show stopper.

Almost black colour with a beige head. Moderate sweet aroma with caramel and fruity notes. Well balanced sweetness in the flavour. Nice mixed blend with chocolate, caramel, fruits and some spices.[Bottle at Amundsen Bryggeri & Spiseri in Oslo, Norway]
Bottle. Very dark brown with medium beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate and caramel. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, caramel, medium sweet, spices, hop, liquorice and a little bitter.
Clear reddish brown with a lasting beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, dried fruit and moderate spicy. Flavor is quite sweet. Sweet finish. Smooth and very soft. 290512
33cl, Scottish brew, from Beers of Europe Setchey, complex brew, spicy/malty and slightly sweet, not too heavy, balanced, clear, small head, good brew
(bottle) clear dark reddish brown with small brown head; aromas of bread, fruit, bit metallic initially; sweetish flavour with no finish, quite good

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2012 330ml bottle. Liquor, sweet aromas. Pours dark brown, hazy, with nice tan head, quickly disipating and some lacing. Medium body and soft carbonation. Taste is sweet, caramel, chocolate, some spicy. Nice one.

Dark brown with scant beige head  / Sweet, syrupy nose of molasses and dark fruit / Medium body, minimal carbonation, sweet and syrupy with good hop balance and finish / Deep, inky flavors of molasses, brown sugar, licorice, dates, prunes, and cherries, but not picking up the coriander which may be overwhelmed by the big flavors / Odd, flat body on this otherwise excellent ale.

Bottle, shared with friends. Dark brown color, minimal khaki head. Little, loose lace. Nice, crisper lighter carbonation. Drier texture. Nice, light sweet and spiced taste. Caramel malts. Light spice. Not bad.

Bottle. Near black pour with a foamy ring. Peaty rooty earthy floral aroma. Wonderful rich complicated flavors. Notes of wilted flowers. Truffle. Dark raisins. Dried figs. Vegemite. Balsamic vinegar. Popourri. Medium full body. Some caramel sweetness but does not feel sticky. Nice warm alcohol presence. Note: Bottle says flavored with coriander - this refers to the leaves of the plant which are known as cilantro in North America.

330ml bottle. Deep reddish-brown body with a small mocha head, poor retention.
Aroma is sweet, with tons of caramel, liquorish, toffee, butterscotch, spices, and a floral presence.
Taste is malty, a little sweetish, god hops bitterness, medicinal, liquorish, and not even a hint of alcohol. Good.

33 cL bottle from Beers of Europe into a Westmalle glass.  Dark red, almost black with a very shortlived creamy head.  Pleasant aromatic and spiced aroma.  Light, a touch acidic, spiced and tasty.  Sweet with a little sharpness, a little fruity, creamy, pretty good.

Poured from a refrigerated 11.2 ounce bottle into a brandy snifter. Appearance is a dark brown, near black with a light greyish head of foam that initially shows potential for good retention, but then dissipates quickly. Nice sheets of lacing. In the aroma I get notes of dark fruits and spices. A muted earthiness is prevalent in the scent with a slight licorice note lingering in the background. Upon initial sip, Im loaded up with candied licorice and fennel, maybe this is what coriander tastes like. Just a mild sweetness that gives way to a burn of booze. Mild and creamy mouthfeel with a lingering licorice aftertaste. I like this beer. Glad something of this nature makes it to West Virginia.

Pours a prune juice colour with some creamy white head. Lots of dried fruit, malts and yeast on the nose.  Both texturally and flavour-wise, its like chewing on some delicious raisin bread. Sir, may I have another? Excellence.

Two years after the best date on the bottle, pores clear and smells of butterscotch and roasted hops with a slight citrus hint. Dark brown with a minimal head, tastes fairly sweet, heavy berryish mouthfeel. Full bodied, soft, creamy, very low carbonation and very little aftertaste.
11.2 oz bottle pours deep brown with a tan head.  Aroma of caramel malts, spices and coffee.  Taste is the malts, coffee and a bit of sweetness.
11.2 FL. OZ Bottle. Dark brown colour with a nice creamy head. Aroma of licorice, citrus, coriander. Something for everyone but in good dosage. An excellent beer.

Pours very dark and brown, looks black in the glass.  Small off white head.  Nose is caramel, butterscotch, toffee, mild coffee and chocolate and banana.  Taste is sweet, with a tad bit o bitter and salt on the end.  Well balanced finish.  Mouthfeel is creamy and slick, medium body with a medium aftertaste.  Not bad at all.

On 1 Nov 2011 I wrote this: 330ml bottle, found in Las Vegas and brought home to the UK 18 months ago: I figured it will have settled by now.

Poured into my Westmalle chalice: Ruby red with only a thin collar and mini wisp for a topping.

The smell at first was vinous, then comes dark chocolate, red berries and plum bread all at once, lovely.

This is my sort of beer, rich, almost smooth: the semi-sharpness of the hop bitterness reminds you this isnt supposed to be soft, its a Scotch Ale not a Milk Stout! There are a multitude of flavours to find: spices from the Orient, berries from the forest, dried fruits in a Christmas cake, malts from a distillery, haggis from the hills. Take a sip and close your eyes, wonderful: let your taste buds go crazy.

This is a warming, winters brew and so, so well made: the alcohol is well hidden, comes out towards the end of the drying mouth, but not harsh or unpleasant, just letting you know that the car keys should be given to someone else.

If only the beer looked better in my glass (I do love a proud, deep head on my beers).

Pours very dark with little head.  Malt, dark fruit, molasses and some peaty, earthy notes in the aroma. Taste has caramel, toffee, and molasses.  A little bitterness and alcohol give nice balance in the finish.  Definitely worth seeking out.
Pub. 33 cl, bottled. Pours black. Aroma: Light roasted malt, mämmi. Taste: Med (+) sweet, light bitterness. Palate is medium bodied and a  bit oily. Some carbonation.
Bottle. Dark brown with tan head. Sweet with caramel, fruit and nutty flavours. Really good.
Glass mug.  Dark brown with very little head.  Definitely smell the coriander.  It has a dense mouthfeel, but not viscous.  A little sweet, tastes like oaked molasses.  Very tasty.

Bottle. Dark brown with a creamy head of moderate durability. Aroma is a complex combination of licorice, dark chocolate, caramel, light coffee, notes of red wine, and coriander-based notes of citrus, white grapes, tea, and even eau de cologne. Wow, this is complex! The coriander is less prominent than in a typical witbier for example and goes lovely with the "dark" aroma elements (licorice and dark chocolate). Seriously, I could just enjoy the beer by only sniffing it. Flavour-wise licorice and coriander are at the forefront, backed by a more subtle presence of chocolate and caramel. Light bitter finish with an aftertaste of licorice, coriander, white grapes, orange and chocolate. Fantastically hidden alcohol. Very aromatic beer yet at the same time subtle and mellow, devoid of any harshness - using wooden tuns by the brewery serves it really well. Top quality stuff, to sip over and over again.

Strong aroma has a malty and fruity core and a firm smoky overtone with molasses and mocha notes, more like a stout or porter. It pours a dark, barely translucent chocolate brown with a respectable light tan head that leaves some generous lacing. Mouth-filling flavor has firm fruity, malty, nutty and caramel tones plus subtle chocolate, coffee and toffee notes. It is sweet but not cloying, with just a touch of hop bitterness and a firm alcohol nip. Smooth, heavy texture has a syrupy feel and not a whole lot of fizz. This one is worthy of a hunt.
Bottle from iron abbey beer dinner. Pours dark brown, with aroma and taste of sweetness, mostly caramel.  Clean, smooth finish.
Color marron muy oscuro y cabeza de espuma beige de duracion media. Aroma a uvas pasas y malta. Sabor dulce a caramelo con toques a ciruela.

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2012 Uh là là! Birra davvero di spessore. Leggermente liquorosa, si apprezza la presenza di sentori di cioccolato. Il luppolo non passa inosservato. Ho sentito un pizzicore di malto tostato e una nota di liquirizia.

Deep cola brown with hints of garnet (darker than the house ale I think).  film of sea foam, rich almond cream.  Less sweet than the house ale, more fresh evergreen hops (light as opposed to a hint).  Spice is sort of like a flower garden in the aroma, light, and natural.  Flavor is very refreshing, fairly sweet with a bunch of that good ol coriander, mmm, very apparent, slightly orangy, as Ive read it described as in one of those brewing books.  Very good, nice to see coriander outside of a wit, if only someone would make a wit without it...  Body is medium, a bit more syrupy than the house ale.  Very good!
Bottle at taberna belga, braga, Portugal. Dark redish color. Thin brownish head. Medium carbonation. Medium sweetness. Alcohol, spices, toast, caramel aroma.

[4185-20111210] Bottle. Strange spiced fruit aroma has a floral leaf base. Clear, dark brown amber body with a long-lasting foamy off-white head. Odd fruity floral malt flavour has a spiced finish. Medium body. Interesting, not super boozy. (6/3/6/3/13) 3.1
(c/o tuqueboy, w/ him, jerc, others)

Reddish brown pour with a thin beige head. Brown sugar, raisin, slightly oxidized bready malts, multi grain wheat loaf, and caramel lead to hints of toffee and cereal grains. Medium body with very low carbonation and an oily finish.

330mL thanks craftcarl21. Pours clear deeper amber to mahogany. Smaller tan head with weak wispy lace. Nose is brown sugar, sweet fruit juice, big raisin, slightly oxidized character, muted spice complexities. Taste is tingly up front with sweet raisin ending clean and slightly thin. Really no bitterness. Sweet, light palate. Ending a bit papery. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy cola colored pour, smallish white bubbly head. Nose holds huge amounts of raisin, plum, fig, toffee, and a touch of bready malt that might be just a touch of oxidation. Flavor is more of the same, dark fruit, spice and bread- I probably held on to this far too long for some reason. A touch thin on the palate. Oh well.

Rusty Brown colour with a reasonable tan head that leaves behind some good lacing. Aroma is molasses, raisins, brandy, spices. Taste is raisins, toffee, licorice, spices, candi sugar. Well balanced, very tasty, quite complex, very reminiscent of Belgians.

Pours a rusty brown color with a beige head. The nose has raisins, brandies cherries, dark chocolate, and hints of Unami. Tastes of raisin followed by chocolate, and bing cherries. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from LCBO.  Pours a deep clear brown.  Aroma is sweet malt, pepper, and coriander.  Tastes of caramel, brown sugar, a hint of spiciness, a little alcohol, and has a lingering herbal bitterness.  Aggressively carbonated, but not in a bad way.  A very enjoyable beer.

Pours dark reddish brown (almost black) with a medium tan head. Aroma is sweet, fruity & spicy (maybe some licorice) - the malts are there too. Taste is rich, smooth.....some alcohol sweetness.....and something vegetal. Interesting beer. Very smooth. For me, its hard to pinpoint anything exact in the flavor. Good beer, however.

Color: Black
Aroma: Sweet, Raisin, toffee
Body:Raisin, sweet, not hops, hint of coriander
Finish: Some alcohol, slightly roasted malt, some dryness
Over-all/Mouth-feel: Big, rich, complex

Not too sure about this one. On the one hand its very enjoyable, but there seems to be something missing, that could make it exceptional. Maybe its the fact that it doesnt seem to know if it wants to be a quaffer or a sipper. Lots of berry fruits, some cinammon and other sweet spices and a very smooth body, perhaps to its disadvantage. Not terribly complex. An odd one to be sure.

Murky dark amber brown, small mocha head. Dark spiced malt aroma. Roasted sweet malt taste, some spice, caramel and dried fruit. Alcohol is well hidden. Moderately hopped, softly carbed. Sweet clean finish. LBW (Lagerboys Be Wary)
12 ounce bottle. A nicely spiced malty beer. I enjoy the fruity character of the coriander as it blends with the malts and yeast. It is very drinkable. A nice beer that is a bit of a treat.

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2012 (33CL Bottle) This really was good , basically .  Ive wanted to sample this awhile and no ant-climax here.  Very sophisticated in character -its silky ,chocolatiness  with spices bathing in it ....

Intéressant bouquet composé de figues, cassonade et mélasse provenant dune magnifique robe bourgogne bien pétillante. Au goût cest semblable au parfum avec une présence en bouche remarquablement soyeuse et un arrière goût malté persistant.

An excellent beer.  Initial smell of caramelized malts and coriander.  The coriander follows through on the taste but is well intermingled, enough to disguise among a roast caramel malt taste.  Well worth it.  350ml bottle

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2012 the aroma is rich and comforting  .amazing light to shiny amber appearance .a complex malt profile with a excellent designed hop balance . the carbonation is soft in the mouth . this is when science meet true art .
Nice beer. I was expecting a strange taste with the coriander added but it complemented the beer perfectly and did not overpower the taste. I very much enjoyed this beer.
Sweet malty aroma, which to me, was very reminiscent of a highland single malt - caramel, bread, and raisin notes. Body is similar to the nose, but with more spice. Finish is nutmeg and ginger. Good.

Pours a deep brown-red.  Quickly dissapating head.  Spicey herbal and licorice notes from the aroma.  Taste of malt, coriander and all the notes from the aroma upfront, shifting to spicy, vegetal, hoppy bitterness.  Very slight numbing sensation before a mildly bitter, warming finish.

330 bottle. Dark ruby pour. Lots going on here. Real herbal tones in the aroma - the coriander, anise, dark berries and molasses. Smooth and oily, very nice balance. Herbal and fruity up front, with a little brown sugar sweetness.  Finishes with a bitter grapefruit and black tea. High ABV of 8% well hidden. Nice balance. Very nice strong beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very good. The aroma is malty but the smell of the coriander and some floral notes push through. The beer is deep brown with a very quickly disappearing head.  The taste is roasty caramel notes mix in with floral and herbal notes. Really just a well balanced flavorful brew. The mouthfeel is medium with subtle carbonation and a fresh clean crispness. Delightful.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2012 Aroma: Interesting....herby, liquoricey, floral. Burnt caramel, gingerbread...smells nice. 
Appearance: Transparent dark red, almost black. The head is kinda minimal and needed encouragement on pour. 
Taste: Liquorice, dark malts, caramel, spices and herbs. Reminds me of Jagermeister.
Palate: Rich and full bodied, not much carbonation. Balanced pretty well.
Overall: Very interesting beer, lots of character for sure!

Another one of those uber-common beers Im just now getting around to. 11.2 ounce bottle from Market Street Wine Shop Uptown Charlottesville. Pours a clear dark brown color with a thin tan head that quickly fades. Aroma of butter, spice, berries, caramel and sawdust. The taste is bread, caramel, anise, other spices, bitter hops, berries and a bit of butter. Yay for alliteration! Medium bodied. Not bad but not too well balanced and a little disjointed.

Nutty, roasted smell, with no discernible hops.  Initial pour was creamy, dissolving to a thin lace.  First taste was moderately sweet and the finish is slightly bitter, but pleasantly so.  Aftertaste is a burnt roasted maltiness.  No lace left on glass.  Surprisingly light for the color and ABV, and not much of an alcohol taste either.  Not very carbonated.  I enjoyed this beer, it was quite drinkable, though I didnt find it to be that remarkable overall.

(bottle) Clear very dark slightly reddish brown / chestnut with next to no head. Rich and sweet aroma with notes of dried fruit and toffee. Oily full bodied palate with modest carbonation. Beautiful complex flavour with dried fruit, toffee, orange peel, cardamon and spice. Overall an awesome beer.

1995 Bottle  . almost flat  no head  very dark brown / black colour  slightly sour / port / liqorice aroma -hint of herbs    first thought was maybe it has aged too long and will taste like vinegar  .  Not so  -  taste is like spicy port  with spicy liqorice hints  - not quite as full bodied as port but feels bigger than the 8% abv  on the bottle  . not bad but probably need to try a younger version

Poured a dark chestnut tinged with deep ruby. Some molasses, bread, vanilla and dark fruits on the nose. More molasses in the flavour with toffee, caramel and vanilla. Subtle spices on the back as well. Full, smooth mouthfeel. Very subtle and complex flavour profile going on in this one.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2011 
It pours a dark ruby with orange highlights; the head is off cream and fluffy. The aroma consists of: vanilla, fruitcake, coriander, and a faint hint of fennel. The taste is medium-light sweetness that finishes lightly bitter; the notes are: coriander (top-note), figs, toffee (finish). The palate is medium-full bodied, with a boisterous presence. Overall, nice - but nothing all that special.

Pours dark brown with a thin, tan head. On the nose are cherry cough drops, plums, vanilla, and a hint of smoke. Mouth feel is chewy and possesses light to medium carbonation.  Taste-wise is very rich and earthy: we have plums, raisins, burnt bread, nuts, toffee, caramel, dark chocolate, scotch whisky, and oak. Finish is long and medium bitter leaving dark chocolate and  coffee. An absolutely delicious beer that is perfectly balanced. Very reminiscent of a good Scotch whisky.

The beer pours a very deep ruby color with an average, beige, pillowy froth which is somewhat lasting and leaves minimal lace rings.  The nose is interesting with toffee, cocoa, molasses, raisin, and fig.  The flavor is similar with lots of toffee, cocoa, plenty of raisin and fig, and some vanilla bean.  The palate is medium, soft carbonation, and silky.  The beer finishes still rich and fruity with fig, toffee, cocoa, and some almond notes emerging.  An odd beer to say the least; very drinkable, especially considering the ABV and totally malt forward beer but still finding enough balance even with the non-existent hop presence.  Their was the typical high sulfate water from this UK beer but it didnt affect the overall beer.  Good and unique but not great.
Bottle. Dark brown with tan head. Toffee chocolate aroma. Taste is similar. Smooth. Pretty tasty

33 cl bottle @ home, BBE 01/2019
Aroma is rather unique with caramel, coriander and salmiac. Flavour feels sugary but it is not actually very sweet. It has some salmiac and coriander too. Somewhat confusing taste  maybe my expections were just too high on this almost-three-year-old bottle.
Very dark shade of brown in appearance. Strong chocolate notes in taste, caramel, and berry undertones as well. Would have liked a little more carbonation, but still a very good a beer.

Bottle at Buchanans Bistro, Banchory. It pours deep brown, with a thin fizzy tan head. The nose is very fruity: plum, raisin, prune, strawberry, red grape, raspberry, blackcurrant, stewed pear, toffee and some spice. The taste is caramel, red grape, prune, plum, raisin, toffee, spice, lingering alcohol warmth, chocolate, touch of varnish, medicinal and coffee, with a warming, dry-roasted finish. Full body, moderate carbonation, velvety mouth-feel and great balance. Very well done.

Short aroma. A bit of caramel, toast, bread. Clear dark brown with a brownish head which evaporates quickly. A slight sweetness with some salt. Very little bitterness. Nice full body, creamy feeling. Almost no carbonation. Long finish.
A very nice dark beer which hides its 8%.

33 cl flaska. Drucken samtidigt som Traquir House ale. Denna var mer av allt. Mörkare brun. Mer doft, lite sötare och inslag av mörka röda bär. Detta återkommer i smaken tillsammans med en aning lakrits.

Bottle. (On trip to WV about a month ago.) Dark brown, thin head. Aroma reminds me of Grand Marnier. Hmmm... interesting. Sweet, thick, with a little fruit- like liqueur. Thick and sticky palate but diminishes quickly.

THOUGHTS: Nice. Very herbal. A little like a beer version of Jägermeister at first. But then it changed. A little herbal and very malty. Not far off from a very good wee heavy, really. The coriander wasnt very noticeable as a distinct flavor or aroma. It just added an herbal or spice undertone. Id like to try to age some of this bad boy. It has a lot of potential. Hid alcohol well.
TECHNICAL: Bottle. Poured and extremely dark red that looked brown to black in the glass with bright red highlights and a large to huge, off-white head that mostly diminished and left fair lacing. It also had nice carbonation. The aroma had heavy caramel, molasses and chocolate; raisin, prune, toffee, maple syrup, cherry cola, dark pruney fruit, some herbs and little smoke and soy sauce. The initial flavor was moderately sweet; while the finish was heavily sweet, slightly bitter and lightly sour. There was cherry cola, molasses, caramel, chocolate, prune, raisin, other dark fruit, smoke, some herbs which might be the coriander, they slight spice and a little soy. The little heavier than medium body was syrupy, a little sticky on the lips and a bit oily with moderately fizzy carbonation and a metallic and slightly alcoholic finish.

[330ml bottle, Drinkmonger Edinburgh] Darkish brown pour with a thin off-white head. Roasted malt nose with more than a hint of sweet marzipan. Some spice on the taste, but less than I was expecting. The body is a pretty good; there are some good roasty moments before some more sweetness arrives at the end in a big whoosh, along with that missing spice. It kind of reminded me of an Anchor Special in that regard. Good stuff [13102011]

Bottle.
Clear dark brown/red with a short pale brown head.
Vinous aroma with a swift puff of yeast then comes dark fruit and berries, spice, some chocolate, tobacco, licorice or fennel and a slight sting of alcohol. Something burnt and earthy.
Vinous taste with dark fruit and berries, chocolate, licorice root, burnt caramel. Spicy herby bitter aftertaste.
Super smooth mouthfeel with low carbonation and a good body.
Wow, classy!

Bottle 33cl. Dark brown colour with light brown creamy head with medium persistence. Toasted malt aroma, wood, licorice and brown sugar are also present. Taste to light sugar, with medium density and full bodied. Flat carbonation with an aftertaste light sweet.
Som andra Traquairöl mycket torkad frukt, främst russin i både doft och smak, mörk karamell och söt lakrits, lätt pepprig eftersmak, kraftig alkholvärme. Bra balans även m den är ganska söt.

11.09.02 sampled at bieres et saveurs A: dry raisins, brown sugar, caramel, licorice, dark caramel. App: deep red white with beige head T/P: full body long sugary finish O: Excellent great depth of flavour tons of sugars. A must have drink for everyone white a sweet tooth.

pours almost copper brown with a hint of red colour. some head and shows lace. sweet aromas and malted as well. some weird spice that i cant quite place. the palate is sweet, medium bodied, has a malted and molasses flavour. decent!
Bottle fae Beets. Pours Black/Brown. Slight head. Smells sweet. Malt and spice. Very well balanced. Delicious.

20/09/2011 330ml bottle. Color tonaca di frate con riflessi caramello, buona schiuma grigiastra-beige, poco persistente. Naso fantastico, liquirizia, caramello, frutta secca. In bocca perde leggermente, le note di liquirizia sono un po eccessive e fastidiose, così come il caramello, entrambi stucchevoli alla lunga. Resta comunque una eccellente birra, di squisita fattura. Corpo medio, carbonazione soft.

Bottle at Bishops arms Bellamnsgatan.
Pours brown without any head.
Spicy taste of fudge and rather sweet malt.

Deep brown with a thin lacing. Roasted malts and clipped by the spicy aroma and cola sweetness. Taste of pepper and semi sweet chocolate. Low hop bitterness to balance the dark malt taste. Stays on the tongue a while with the burnt spice gradually fading. Unique brew to say the least.

11.2 oz bottle into English pint. Says "Best Before June 2019" on the label. Pours a deep dark brown with a small beige head that fades into a blanket of foam. Aroma is cloying malty sweet. Lots of caramel and overripe fruit. Its pretty stinky. Taste is really sweet but I dont find it cloying like I did the aroma. Its actually quite good, like liquid dessert. Carbonation is pretty light and the body is full. Its good but I dont know if Id go out of my way to buy it again.

Pours a dark deep cola color with the aroma of mild chocolate.  Taste is of roasted chocolate almonds.  This beer is simply delicious, very subtle and smooth tasting.  Overall very complex taste with an easy drinkability, I would of drank more except I had the last two the bar had on stock.

Bottle from the Bitter Experience, Bromley. Dark reddish-brown pour. A nose dominated by sweet spices, toffee, caramel and raisins. Tasty flavours of caramel, licorice, treacle and brown sugar. Warming. Dry, spicy finish. Nice.
wicked good. Exactly what I like in a beer: big bold balanced flavour, complex, and clean finish. I drank it so fast I didnt pay much attention to the subtleties.

350 mL bottle. Pours cola brown with almost no head. The aroma is molasses, toffee and roasted malts. The flavor is sweet and a little burned bitterness. The palate is medium, sticky, flat and a little grainy. Overall, this is an underwhelming beer.

Bottle. Aromas of smoky malt and syrupy brown sugar on an odd spicy background. A definite flavour of coriander, plus tree leaf, Ovaltine and a general herbaciousness. While the effort and originality is impressive, the overall profile is a little too peculiar; would not have again.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with virtually no head. Nose is sweet. Taste is slightly bitter, with a strong malty, caramel backbone with a hint of spiciness. Alcohol is evident and prevalent. Full body. Reminds me of Rochefort 8-which is a good thing. I like this and will buy more soon.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: In bottle. Pour a dark brown colour with a lacy light tan head. Aroma of treacle, caramel and molasses. Flavours of caramel and treacle again. Chewy mouth-feel. Very nice! I much prefer this to the house ale.
Dark ale flavored with coriander. It has well balanced hops and malts with Traditional Ale nuances. A great beer that is very smooth with roasted malt flavor.

Bottle (dmg notes). Dark with a sandy, golden head. Anise, berries and tobacco in aroma. Flavour of licorice, dark malts and coffes. Sweet and pleasantly bitter. The main beer behind the story of ØlKonsortiet.
UPDATED: JUL 21, 2015 Dark brown body off white gead. Sweet molasses and bubblegum  aroms. Rich deep malty taste .  Aby well  masked. Excellent  beer.

Deep ruby-brown pour with no head and no lace. Smooth, dark-roasted malt flavors of dates, subtle spices and ripe cherries. Hops are present throughout, adding a resinous bitterness. Nicely balanced, medium-heavy body, lightly carbonated. A delicious, sessionable beer with a well-hidden ABV.

Bottle at home. Deep, deep reddish brown, thick creamy off-white head. Little burnt, chocolate, dark fruit nose. Oily body, palate of chocolate and liquorice. Slight boozy chocolate on the finish. Similar to the house ale but a bit thicker, less fruit. Another top-drawer brew from Traquair though.

Une petite tête flotte sur un liquide brun, bien comparable à la couleur dun cola.  Au nez, le chocolat, le caramel, les épices et les fruits font penser quelque peu à la boisson chinotto et ses extraits particuliers dherbes et daromates.  Les saveurs sont très intéressantes et fortement similaires aux arômes : le malt est doux, diversifié, presque riche, fruité et sans aucun doute bonifié par les parfums épicés.  En bouche, le liquide étonne avec sa belle rondeur, sa douce effervescence et sa texture légèrement huileuse.  La finale est envoûtante et assez longue, pleine de réglisse et de notes fruitées douces et amères.  En résumé, très bonne bière.
Bottle from Alko. Originally rated on 13.12.2009. Strong, complex and tasty. Notes of raisin and malts. Slick finish.

12oz bottle from IPB.

Appearance : Dark amber with a small creamy head. Not much lacing.

Aroma : Lots of raisins and overcooked caramel. Rich dark fruits with light floral notes. Some spices.

Taste : Rich fruits with brown sugar and caramel. Light metallic notes that goes away after some time. Light floral notes with spices. Light bitterness on the finish with floral hops, spices and overcooked caramel.

Palate : Soft carbonation.
Overall : Nice nose, quite complex and well balanced. Nice taste too but nothing really special. House Ale was much better from what I remember. Quite floral. Very interesting. Warm finish.

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2011 Bouteille de 33cl. Bière brune avec des reflets rouges, la mousse est beige. Le nez est très caramélisé avec une sous couche dépices très agréables. La bouche respecte le nez avec en plus une pointe dalcool. Le caramel est incroyable et les épices(cannelle, muscade??) rend cette bière très digeste. Elle est ronde en bouche. Jaime cette bière.

Could swear the last time I had this it was a lot better, Oh well, no matter. I let it sit out a bit to warm up. It poured with a small, fizzy, tan head that quickly disappeared in total. Color I think might be clear, but is in any case a very dark,  if not opaque brown with garnet highlights. Aroma is dark ripe fruits like figs and raisins, dark roast malt, molassses. Flavor is similar to nose. Body is a tad flat and yet not bad. Finish is like flavor plus some extended dark roasty malt flavors that last a bit along with some booziness.

Pours a deep brown body with a fading beige/tan head.  Aromas of soy sauce, molasses, herbal.  Flavors are much the same.  Some dark fruit all around. Finish is slightly dry with lasting dark sweetness.  Low carbonation.

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2011 Bottle from The Bottle, York
Appearance Dark brown with off white head.
Aroma Spicy, perfumy malt with herbs, port. No hops.
Taste Caramel sweet malt, port notes, again herbs, spicy, bit medicinal. Not much hop detectable.
Palate Average carbonation. Sweet malty, warming, slightly dry finish, which was very good.
Overall Very drinkable for the ABV, sort of like an imperial scottish ale, with extra spice (from coriander) and port-wine notes. I was impressed with this beer as I havent tried Traquair beers before.

a very easy beer to drink, the spiciness really gives this beer an extra dimension that is not found normally. The base beer is a scottish ale, not a scotch ale that is normally way too malty sweet for me, but more of a caramel scottish ale with dark fruit spice added. Really easy and delicious.

Bottle. Deep brown body. Small, frothy, light brown head, mostly diminishing. Strong aroma of sweet dark fruits, carmel, cherry, coriander. The flavor is moderately to heavily sweet, lightly acidic and lightly bitter. It finishes It finishes moderately sweet, lightly to moderately bitter and lightly to moderately acidic. Medium body, watery texture and lively carbonation. Some slickness in the finish. Taste of sweet licorice, black cherries. After a great aroma, the flavor is disappointing, overly sweet with a chalky off-taste in the finish. Still, its interesting and complex.

Bottle. Poured a dark brown with a creamy tan head that settled to a ring. Sweet aroma of dark fruits and a malt background. The flavor found light roasted malt and fruit. Medium body, sweet, and a fruit aftertaste.

UPDATED: OCT 9, 2011 Re-rate, the palatge was perfect on this occasion, so up by 1.  So, too the appearance.
Previous rating 21/06/11 = 8/3/8/4/16   
50cl bottle. Pours a chestnut colour with a red hue and a thin head, some of which hangs about. The nose has honey, flowers, lemon thyme and gorse! The taste has honey and wild flowers. The palate is rich in structure and texture and  the finish is good, though would prefer it to clean a bit more! Overall, lovely beer!

Bottle thanks to a great trader. Pours black. Nose/taste of coriander, plum, brown sugar and sweet malt. Hints of chocolate. Coriander is dominant throughout. Taste has a dry orange finish. Medium body.
Pours very dark brown with no head. Aroma is dark fruits, chocolate, malts and alcohol. Flavor is pretty much the same with a bit more alcohol in the finish. Low carbonation. Very nice.
